```diff
+ use axum::{
+     routing::{get, post},
+     Router,
+ };
+ use std::net::SocketAddr;
+ use tower_http::cors::{Any, CorsLayer};
+ use tower_http::trace::TraceLayer;
+ use tracing_subscriber::{layer::SubscriberExt, util::SubscriberInitExt};
+ 
+ mod api;
+ mod git;
+ mod types;
+ mod websocket;
+ 
+ #[tokio::main]
+ async fn main() -&gt; anyhow::Result&lt;()&gt; {
+     // Initialize tracing
+     tracing_subscriber::registry()
+         .with(
+             tracing_subscriber::EnvFilter::try_from_default_env()
+                 .unwrap_or_else(|_| &quot;codex_viz_backend=debug,tower_http=debug&quot;.into()),
+         )
+         .with(tracing_subscriber::fmt::layer())
+         .init();
+ 
+     tracing::info!(&quot;ğŸš€ Codex Viz Backend starting...&quot;);
+ 
+     // Build our application with routes
+     let app = Router::new()
+         // API routes
+         .route(&quot;/api/commits&quot;, get(api::commits::list_commits))
+         .route(&quot;/api/files/heatmap&quot;, get(api::files::get_heatmap))
+         .route(&quot;/api/branches/graph&quot;, get(api::branches::get_graph))
+         // WebSocket route
+         .route(&quot;/api/realtime&quot;, get(websocket::handler))
+         // Health check
+         .route(&quot;/health&quot;, get(health_check))
+         // Add middleware
+         .layer(
+             CorsLayer::new()
+                 .allow_origin(Any)
+                 .allow_methods(Any)
+                 .allow_headers(Any),
+         )
+         .layer(TraceLayer::new_for_http());
+ 
+     // Run server
+     let addr = SocketAddr::from(([127, 0, 0, 1], 3001));
+     tracing::info!(&quot;ğŸŒ Server listening on http://{}&quot;, addr);
+     
+     let listener = tokio::net::TcpListener::bind(addr).await?;
+     axum::serve(listener, app).await?;
+ 
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ async fn health_check() -&gt; &amp;&#39;static str {
+     &quot;OK&quot;
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use chrono::{DateTime, Utc};
+ 
+ /// 3D coordinates for commit visualization
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct Commit3D {
+     pub sha: String,
+     pub message: String,
+     pub author: String,
+     pub author_email: String,
+     pub timestamp: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+     pub branch: String,
+     pub parents: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     // 3D coordinates
+     pub x: f32,  // Branch axis
+     pub y: f32,  // Time axis
+     pub z: f32,  // Depth axis (parent-child relationship)
+     
+     // Color for author differentiation
+     pub color: String,
+ }
+ 
+ /// File change statistics for heatmap
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct FileStats {
+     pub path: String,
+     pub change_count: u32,
+     pub additions: u32,
+     pub deletions: u32,
+     pub last_modified: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+     pub authors: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     
+     // Heatmap visualization data
+     pub heat_level: f32,  // 0.0 to 1.0
+     pub size: u64,        // File size in bytes
+ }
+ 
+ /// Branch graph node
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct BranchNode {
+     pub name: String,
+     pub head_sha: String,
+     pub is_active: bool,
+     pub merge_count: u32,
+     pub created_at: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+     pub last_commit: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+     
+     // Graph visualization data
+     pub x: f32,
+     pub y: f32,
+     pub z: f32,
+     pub connections: Vec&lt;BranchConnection&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// Connection between branches (merge points)
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct BranchConnection {
+     pub target_branch: String,
+     pub merge_sha: String,
+     pub connection_type: ConnectionType,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ #[serde(rename_all = &quot;lowercase&quot;)]
+ pub enum ConnectionType {
+     Merge,
+     Fork,
+     Rebase,
+ }
+ 
+ /// Real-time event for WebSocket
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ #[serde(tag = &quot;type&quot;, rename_all = &quot;snake_case&quot;)]
+ pub enum RealtimeEvent {
+     NewCommit {
+         commit: Commit3D,
+     },
+     FileChanged {
+         path: String,
+         change_type: ChangeType,
+     },
+     BranchCreated {
+         branch: BranchNode,
+     },
+     BranchDeleted {
+         branch_name: String,
+     },
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ #[serde(rename_all = &quot;lowercase&quot;)]
+ pub enum ChangeType {
+     Added,
+     Modified,
+     Deleted,
+ }
+ 
+ /// API response wrapper
+ #[derive(Debug, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ApiResponse&lt;T&gt; {
+     pub success: bool,
+     pub data: Option&lt;T&gt;,
+     pub error: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl&lt;T&gt; ApiResponse&lt;T&gt; {
+     pub fn success(data: T) -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             success: true,
+             data: Some(data),
+             error: None,
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     pub fn error(message: impl Into&lt;String&gt;) -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             success: false,
+             data: None,
+             error: Some(message.into()),
+         }
+     }
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ use crate::types::{BranchNode, Commit3D, ConnectionType, BranchConnection, FileStats};

+ 
+ /// Git repository analyzer for 3D visualization
+ pub struct GitAnalyzer {
+     repo: Repository,
+     color_map: HashMap&lt;String, String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl GitAnalyzer {
+     /// Open a git repository at the given path
+     pub fn open(path: impl AsRef&lt;Path&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         let repo = Repository::open(path).context(&quot;Failed to open git repository&quot;)?;
+         
+         Ok(Self {
+             repo,
+             color_map: HashMap::new(),
+         })
+     }
+ 
+     /// Analyze commits and generate 3D coordinates
+     pub fn analyze_commits(&amp;mut self, max_commits: Option&lt;usize&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;Commit3D&gt;&gt; {
+         let mut revwalk = self.repo.revwalk()?;
+         revwalk.push_head()?;
+         revwalk.set_sorting(git2::Sort::TIME)?;
+ 
+         let mut commits = Vec::new();
+         let mut branch_positions: HashMap&lt;String, f32&gt; = HashMap::new();
+         let mut depth_map: HashMap&lt;Oid, f32&gt; = HashMap::new();
+ 
+         let limit = max_commits.unwrap_or(1000);
+         let mut count = 0;
+ 
+         for oid_result in revwalk {
+             if count &gt;= limit {
+                 break;
+             }
+ 
+             let oid = oid_result?;
+             let commit = self.repo.find_commit(oid)?;
+ 
+             // Calculate 3D coordinates
+             let branch_name = self.get_branch_for_commit(&amp;commit)?;
+             let x = self.get_branch_position(&amp;branch_name, &amp;mut branch_positions);
+             let y = commit.time().seconds() as f32;
+             let z = self.calculate_depth(&amp;commit, &amp;mut depth_map)?;
+ 
+             // Get or generate author color
+             let author_email = commit.author().email().unwrap_or(&quot;unknown&quot;).to_string();
+             let color = self.get_author_color(&amp;author_email);
+ 
+             let commit_3d = Commit3D {
+                 sha: format!(&quot;{}&quot;, oid),
+                 message: commit.message().unwrap_or(&quot;&quot;).to_string(),
+                 author: commit.author().name().unwrap_or(&quot;Unknown&quot;).to_string(),
+                 author_email: author_email.clone(),
+                 timestamp: DateTime::from_timestamp(commit.time().seconds(), 0)
+                     .unwrap_or_else(|| Utc::now()),
+                 branch: branch_name,
+                 parents: commit.parent_ids().map(|p| format!(&quot;{}&quot;, p)).collect(),
+                 x,
+                 y,
+                 z,
+                 color,
+             };
+ 
+             commits.push(commit_3d);
+             count += 1;
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(commits)
+     }
+ 
+     /// Analyze file change statistics for heatmap
+     pub fn analyze_file_stats(&amp;self, max_commits: Option&lt;usize&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;FileStats&gt;&gt; {
+         let mut file_map: HashMap&lt;String, FileStatsBuilder&gt; = HashMap::new();
+         
+         let mut revwalk = self.repo.revwalk()?;
+         revwalk.push_head()?;
+ 
+         let limit = max_commits.unwrap_or(1000);
+         let mut count = 0;
+ 
+         for oid_result in revwalk {
+             if count &gt;= limit {
+                 break;
+             }
+ 
+             let oid = oid_result?;
+             let commit = self.repo.find_commit(oid)?;
+ 
+             // Get diff for this commit
+             let tree = commit.tree()?;
+             let parent_tree = if commit.parent_count() &gt; 0 {
+                 Some(commit.parent(0)?.tree()?)
+             } else {
+                 None
+             };
+ 
+             let diff = self.repo.diff_tree_to_tree(
+                 parent_tree.as_ref(),
+                 Some(&amp;tree),
+                 None,
+             )?;
+ 
+             // Process each file in the diff
+             diff.foreach(
+                 &amp;mut |delta, _| {
+                     if let Some(path) = delta.new_file().path() {
+                         let path_str = path.to_string_lossy().to_string();
+                         let author = commit.author().email().unwrap_or(&quot;unknown&quot;).to_string();
+                         
+                         file_map
+                             .entry(path_str)
+                             .or_insert_with(FileStatsBuilder::default)
+                             .increment(author);
+                     }
+                     true
+                 },
+                 None,
+                 None,
+                 None,
+             )?;
+ 
+             count += 1;
+         }
+ 
+         // Convert to FileStats
+         let max_changes = file_map.values().map(|s| s.change_count).max().unwrap_or(1) as f32;
+         
+         let stats: Vec&lt;FileStats&gt; = file_map
+             .into_iter()
+             .map(|(path, builder)| {
+                 let heat_level = (builder.change_count as f32 / max_changes).min(1.0);
+                 FileStats {
+                     path: path.clone(),
+                     change_count: builder.change_count,
+                     additions: builder.additions,
+                     deletions: builder.deletions,
+                     last_modified: builder.last_modified,
+                     authors: builder.authors.into_iter().collect(),
+                     heat_level,
+                     size: self.get_file_size(&amp;path).unwrap_or(0),
+                 }
+             })
+             .collect();
+ 
+         Ok(stats)
+     }
+ 
+     /// Analyze branch structure for graph visualization
+     pub fn analyze_branches(&amp;mut self) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;BranchNode&gt;&gt; {
+         let mut branches = Vec::new();
+         let mut branch_positions: HashMap&lt;String, f32&gt; = HashMap::new();
+ 
+         // Get all branches
+         let branch_iter = self.repo.branches(Some(BranchType::Local))?;
+ 
+         for branch_result in branch_iter {
+             let (branch, _) = branch_result?;
+             let name = branch.name()?.unwrap_or(&quot;unknown&quot;).to_string();
+             
+             if let Some(oid) = branch.get().target() {
+                 let commit = self.repo.find_commit(oid)?;
+                 
+                 // Calculate position
+                 let x = self.get_branch_position(&amp;name, &amp;mut branch_positions);
+                 
+                 // Find merge information
+                 let connections = self.find_branch_connections(&amp;name)?;
+                 
+                 let is_active = self.repo.head()?.shorthand() == Some(&amp;name);
+ 
+                 branches.push(BranchNode {
+                     name: name.clone(),
+                     head_sha: format!(&quot;{}&quot;, oid),
+                     is_active,
+                     merge_count: connections.len() as u32,
+                     created_at: DateTime::from_timestamp(commit.time().seconds(), 0)
+                         .unwrap_or_else(|| Utc::now()),
+                     last_commit: DateTime::from_timestamp(commit.time().seconds(), 0)
+                         .unwrap_or_else(|| Utc::now()),
+                     x,
+                     y: commit.time().seconds() as f32,
+                     z: 0.0,
+                     connections,
+                 });
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(branches)
+     }
+ 
+     // Helper methods
+ 
+     fn get_branch_for_commit(&amp;self, commit: &amp;Commit) -&gt; Result&lt;String&gt; {
+         // Try to find which branch this commit belongs to
+         let oid = commit.id();
+         
+         let branches = self.repo.branches(Some(BranchType::Local))?;
+         for branch_result in branches {
+             let (branch, _) = branch_result?;
+             if let Some(branch_oid) = branch.get().target() {
+                 if branch_oid == oid {
+                     return Ok(branch.name()?.unwrap_or(&quot;unknown&quot;).to_string());
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+ 
+         Ok(&quot;main&quot;.to_string())
+     }
+ 
+     fn get_branch_position(&amp;self, branch: &amp;str, positions: &amp;mut HashMap&lt;String, f32&gt;) -&gt; f32 {
+         let len = positions.len();
+         *positions.entry(branch.to_string()).or_insert(len as f32 * 10.0)
+     }
+ 
+     fn calculate_depth(&amp;self, commit: &amp;Commit, depth_map: &amp;mut HashMap&lt;Oid, f32&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;f32&gt; {
+         let oid = commit.id();
+         
+         if let Some(&amp;depth) = depth_map.get(&amp;oid) {
+             return Ok(depth);
+         }
+ 
+         let depth = if commit.parent_count() == 0 {
+             0.0
+         } else {
+             let parent_depths: Vec&lt;f32&gt; = commit
+                 .parents()
+                 .filter_map(|p| depth_map.get(&amp;p.id()).copied())
+                 .collect();
+             
+             if parent_depths.is_empty() {
+                 1.0
+             } else {
+                 parent_depths.iter().copied().fold(0.0, f32::max) + 1.0
+             }
+         };
+ 
+         depth_map.insert(oid, depth);
+         Ok(depth)
+     }
+ 
+     fn get_author_color(&amp;mut self, email: &amp;str) -&gt; String {
+         if let Some(color) = self.color_map.get(email) {
+             return color.clone();
+         }
+ 
+         // Generate a deterministic color based on email hash
+         let hash = email.bytes().fold(0u32, |acc, b| acc.wrapping_mul(31).wrapping_add(b as u32));
+         let hue = (hash % 360) as f32;
+         let color = format!(&quot;hsl({}, 70%, 60%)&quot;, hue);
+         
+         self.color_map.insert(email.to_string(), color.clone());
+         color
+     }
+ 
+     fn find_branch_connections(&amp;self, branch_name: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;Vec&lt;BranchConnection&gt;&gt; {
+         // Simplified: would need more complex logic to detect actual merges
+         Ok(Vec::new())
+     }
+ 
+     fn get_file_size(&amp;self, path: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;u64&gt; {
+         let workdir = self.repo.workdir().context(&quot;No working directory&quot;)?;
+         let file_path = workdir.join(path);
+         
+         if file_path.exists() {
+             Ok(std::fs::metadata(file_path)?.len())
+         } else {
+             Ok(0)
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Default)]
+ struct FileStatsBuilder {
+     change_count: u32,
+     additions: u32,
+     deletions: u32,
+     last_modified: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+     authors: HashSet&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl FileStatsBuilder {
+     fn increment(&amp;mut self, author: String) {
+         self.change_count += 1;
+         self.authors.insert(author);
+         self.last_modified = Utc::now();
+     }
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ use crate::types::{RealtimeEvent, ChangeType};
+ use anyhow::Result;
+ use notify::{Event, EventKind, RecursiveMode, Watcher as NotifyWatcher};
+ use notify_debouncer_full::{new_debouncer, Debouncer, FileIdMap};
+ use std::path::{Path, PathBuf};
+ use std::sync::Arc;
+ use std::time::Duration;
+ use tokio::sync::broadcast;
+ use tracing::{debug, error, info};
+ 
+ /// Git file system watcher for real-time updates
+ pub struct GitWatcher {
+     _debouncer: Debouncer&lt;NotifyWatcher, FileIdMap&gt;,
+     event_tx: broadcast::Sender&lt;RealtimeEvent&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl GitWatcher {
+     /// Create a new GitWatcher for the given repository path
+     pub fn new(repo_path: impl AsRef&lt;Path&gt;) -&gt; Result&lt;(Self, broadcast::Receiver&lt;RealtimeEvent&gt;)&gt; {
+         let repo_path = repo_path.as_ref().to_path_buf();
+         let (event_tx, event_rx) = broadcast::channel(100);
+         let event_tx_clone = event_tx.clone();
+ 
+         // Create debouncer to avoid duplicate events
+         let debouncer = new_debouncer(
+             Duration::from_millis(500),
+             None,
+             move |result: Result&lt;Vec&lt;Event&gt;, Vec&lt;notify::Error&gt;&gt;| {
+                 match result {
+                     Ok(events) =&gt; {
+                         for event in events {
+                             if let Some(realtime_event) = Self::convert_event(&amp;event) {
+                                 let _ = event_tx_clone.send(realtime_event);
+                             }
+                         }
+                     }
+                     Err(errors) =&gt; {
+                         for error in errors {
+                             error!(&quot;Watch error: {:?}&quot;, error);
+                         }
+                     }
+                 }
+             },
+         )?;
+ 
+         // Watch .git directory for ref changes and object updates
+         let git_dir = repo_path.join(&quot;.git&quot;);
+         let mut debouncer_guard = debouncer;
+         debouncer_guard
+             .watcher()
+             .watch(&amp;git_dir, RecursiveMode::Recursive)?;
+ 
+         info!(&quot;ğŸ” Watching git repository at: {:?}&quot;, repo_path);
+ 
+         Ok((
+             Self {
+                 _debouncer: debouncer_guard,
+                 event_tx,
+             },
+             event_rx,
+         ))
+     }
+ 
+     /// Convert notify event to RealtimeEvent
+     fn convert_event(event: &amp;Event) -&gt; Option&lt;RealtimeEvent&gt; {
+         match &amp;event.kind {
+             EventKind::Create(_) =&gt; {
+                 if let Some(path) = event.paths.first() {
+                     Self::classify_git_change(path, ChangeType::Added)
+                 } else {
+                     None
+                 }
+             }
+             EventKind::Modify(_) =&gt; {
+                 if let Some(path) = event.paths.first() {
+                     Self::classify_git_change(path, ChangeType::Modified)
+                 } else {
+                     None
+                 }
+             }
+             EventKind::Remove(_) =&gt; {
+                 if let Some(path) = event.paths.first() {
+                     Self::classify_git_change(path, ChangeType::Deleted)
+                 } else {
+                     None
+                 }
+             }
+             _ =&gt; None,
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     /// Classify what type of git change occurred
+     fn classify_git_change(path: &amp;PathBuf, change_type: ChangeType) -&gt; Option&lt;RealtimeEvent&gt; {
+         let path_str = path.to_string_lossy();
+ 
+         // Check if it&#39;s a ref change (new commit, branch, etc.)
+         if path_str.contains(&quot;.git/refs/&quot;) {
+             debug!(&quot;Detected ref change: {:?}&quot;, path);
+             // Would need to parse the actual change
+             // For now, just return a file changed event
+             return Some(RealtimeEvent::FileChanged {
+                 path: path_str.to_string(),
+                 change_type,
+             });
+         }
+ 
+         // Check if it&#39;s an object change
+         if path_str.contains(&quot;.git/objects/&quot;) {
+             debug!(&quot;Detected object change: {:?}&quot;, path);
+             return Some(RealtimeEvent::FileChanged {
+                 path: path_str.to_string(),
+                 change_type,
+             });
+         }
+ 
+         None
+     }
+ 
+     /// Get a receiver for real-time events
+     pub fn subscribe(&amp;self) -&gt; broadcast::Receiver&lt;RealtimeEvent&gt; {
+         self.event_tx.subscribe()
+     }
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ use crate::git::GitWatcher;
+ use crate::types::RealtimeEvent;
+ use axum::{
+     extract::{
+         ws::{Message, WebSocket},
+         Query, WebSocketUpgrade,
+     },
+     response::Response,
+ };
+ use futures::{sink::SinkExt, stream::StreamExt};
+ use serde::Deserialize;
+ use std::env;
+ use tracing::{debug, error, info};
+ 
+ #[derive(Deserialize)]
+ pub struct WebSocketQuery {
+     #[serde(default)]
+     repo_path: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// WebSocket handler for real-time updates
+ pub async fn handler(
+     ws: WebSocketUpgrade,
+     Query(params): Query&lt;WebSocketQuery&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; Response {
+     let repo_path = params
+         .repo_path
+         .unwrap_or_else(|| env::current_dir().unwrap().to_string_lossy().to_string());
+ 
+     ws.on_upgrade(move |socket| handle_socket(socket, repo_path))
+ }
+ 
+ async fn handle_socket(socket: WebSocket, repo_path: String) {
+     info!(&quot;ğŸ”Œ New WebSocket connection for repo: {}&quot;, repo_path);
+ 
+     let (mut sender, mut receiver) = socket.split();
+ 
+     // Create git watcher
+     let (watcher, mut event_rx) = match GitWatcher::new(&amp;repo_path) {
+         Ok((w, rx)) =&gt; (w, rx),
+         Err(e) =&gt; {
+             error!(&quot;Failed to create GitWatcher: {}&quot;, e);
+             let _ = sender
+                 .send(Message::Text(
+                     serde_json::json!({
+                         &quot;type&quot;: &quot;error&quot;,
+                         &quot;message&quot;: format!(&quot;Failed to watch repository: {}&quot;, e)
+                     })
+                     .to_string(),
+                 ))
+                 .await;
+             return;
+         }
+     };
+ 
+     // Send initial connection success message
+     let _ = sender
+         .send(Message::Text(
+             serde_json::json!({
+                 &quot;type&quot;: &quot;connected&quot;,
+                 &quot;message&quot;: &quot;Real-time updates enabled&quot;
+             })
+             .to_string(),
+         ))
+         .await;
+ 
+     // Spawn task to forward events to WebSocket
+     let mut send_task = tokio::spawn(async move {
+         while let Ok(event) = event_rx.recv().await {
+             match serde_json::to_string(&amp;event) {
+                 Ok(json) =&gt; {
+                     if sender.send(Message::Text(json)).await.is_err() {
+                         break;
+                     }
+                 }
+                 Err(e) =&gt; {
+                     error!(&quot;Failed to serialize event: {}&quot;, e);
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+     });
+ 
+     // Handle incoming messages (ping/pong)
+     let mut recv_task = tokio::spawn(async move {
+         while let Some(Ok(msg)) = receiver.next().await {
+             match msg {
+                 Message::Text(text) =&gt; {
+                     debug!(&quot;Received WebSocket message: {}&quot;, text);
+                 }
+                 Message::Close(_) =&gt; {
+                     debug!(&quot;WebSocket close message received&quot;);
+                     break;
+                 }
+                 Message::Ping(data) =&gt; {
+                     // Respond to ping with pong
+                     debug!(&quot;Received ping&quot;);
+                 }
+                 Message::Pong(_) =&gt; {
+                     debug!(&quot;Received pong&quot;);
+                 }
+                 _ =&gt; {}
+             }
+         }
+     });
+ 
+     // Wait for either task to finish
+     tokio::select! {
+         _ = (&amp;mut send_task) =&gt; {
+             info!(&quot;Send task completed&quot;);
+             recv_task.abort();
+         }
+         _ = (&amp;mut recv_task) =&gt; {
+             info!(&quot;Receive task completed&quot;);
+             send_task.abort();
+         }
+     }
+ 
+     info!(&quot;ğŸ”Œ WebSocket connection closed&quot;);
+ }
+ 
```

</details>

</tool-use>

```diff
+ # Codex Viz Backend
+ 
+ Rust backend server for Kamui4d-style repository visualization.
+ 
+ ## Features
+ 
+ - **REST API** for git repository analysis
+   - &#96;GET /api/commits&#96; - 3D commit history
+   - &#96;GET /api/files/heatmap&#96; - File change statistics
+   - &#96;GET /api/branches/graph&#96; - Branch structure
+ - **WebSocket** for real-time updates (&#96;/api/realtime&#96;)
+ - **Git Analysis Engine** with 3D coordinate calculation
+ - **File System Watcher** for live monitoring
+ 
+ ## Development
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Build
+ cargo build
+ 
+ # Run
+ cargo run
+ 
+ # Server will start on http://127.0.0.1:3001
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## API Examples
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Get commits
+ curl &quot;http://localhost:3001/api/commits?limit=100&quot;
+ 
+ # Get file heatmap
+ curl &quot;http://localhost:3001/api/files/heatmap&quot;
+ 
+ # Get branch graph
+ curl &quot;http://localhost:3001/api/branches/graph&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## WebSocket
+ 
+ Connect to &#96;ws://localhost:3001/api/realtime&#96; for real-time git events.
+
```

```diff
+ 
+ type ViewMode = &#39;commits&#39; | &#39;heatmap&#39; | &#39;branches&#39; | &#39;all&#39;
+ 
+ function App() {
+   const [viewMode, setViewMode] = useState&lt;ViewMode&gt;(&#39;commits&#39;)
+   const [repoPath, setRepoPath] = useState&lt;string&gt;(&#39;&#39;)
+   const [showStats, setShowStats] = useState(false)
+

+     &lt;div className=&quot;app&quot;&gt;

+         &lt;PerspectiveCamera makeDefault position={[50, 50, 50]} fov={60} /&gt;

+           rotateSpeed={0.5}
+           zoomSpeed={0.8}
+         /&gt;
+         
+         {/* Lighting */}
+         &lt;ambientLight intensity={0.5} /&gt;
+         &lt;directionalLight position={[10, 10, 5]} intensity={1} /&gt;
+         &lt;pointLight position={[-10, -10, -10]} intensity={0.5} /&gt;
+ 
+         {/* Grid helper */}
+         &lt;gridHelper args={[200, 20, &#39;#444444&#39;, &#39;#222222&#39;]} /&gt;
+ 
+         &lt;Suspense fallback={&lt;LoadingScreen /&gt;}&gt;
+           {viewMode === &#39;commits&#39; &amp;&amp; &lt;CommitGraph3D repoPath={repoPath} /&gt;}
+           {viewMode === &#39;heatmap&#39; &amp;&amp; &lt;FileHeatMap repoPath={repoPath} /&gt;}
+           {viewMode === &#39;branches&#39; &amp;&amp; &lt;BranchStructure3D repoPath={repoPath} /&gt;}
+           {viewMode === &#39;all&#39; &amp;&amp; (
+             &lt;&gt;
+               &lt;CommitGraph3D repoPath={repoPath} /&gt;
+               &lt;FileHeatMap repoPath={repoPath} /&gt;
+               &lt;BranchStructure3D repoPath={repoPath} /&gt;
+             &lt;/&gt;
+           )}
+         &lt;/Suspense&gt;
+ 
+         {showStats &amp;&amp; &lt;Stats /&gt;}
+       &lt;/Canvas&gt;
+ 
+       &lt;RealtimeMonitor repoPath={repoPath} /&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ export default App
+
```

```diff
+ import axios from &#39;axios&#39;
+ import type { ApiResponse, Commit3D, FileStats, BranchNode } from &#39;../types&#39;
+ 
+ const api = axios.create({
+   baseURL: &#39;/api&#39;,
+   timeout: 30000,
+ })
+ 
+ export async function fetchCommits(
+   repoPath?: string,
+   limit = 1000
+ ): Promise&lt;Commit3D[]&gt; {
+   const params = new URLSearchParams()
+   if (repoPath) params.set(&#39;repo_path&#39;, repoPath)
+   params.set(&#39;limit&#39;, limit.toString())
+ 
+   const response = await api.get&lt;ApiResponse&lt;Commit3D[]&gt;&gt;(
+     &#96;/commits?${params.toString()}&#96;
+   )
+ 
+   if (response.data.success &amp;&amp; response.data.data) {
+     return response.data.data
+   }
+ 
+   throw new Error(response.data.error || &#39;Failed to fetch commits&#39;)
+ }
+ 
+ export async function fetchFileHeatmap(
+   repoPath?: string,
+   limit = 1000
+ ): Promise&lt;FileStats[]&gt; {
+   const params = new URLSearchParams()
+   if (repoPath) params.set(&#39;repo_path&#39;, repoPath)
+   params.set(&#39;limit&#39;, limit.toString())
+ 
+   const response = await api.get&lt;ApiResponse&lt;FileStats[]&gt;&gt;(
+     &#96;/files/heatmap?${params.toString()}&#96;
+   )
+ 
+   if (response.data.success &amp;&amp; response.data.data) {
+     return response.data.data
+   }
+ 
+   throw new Error(response.data.error || &#39;Failed to fetch file heatmap&#39;)
+ }
+ 
+ export async function fetchBranchGraph(repoPath?: string): Promise&lt;BranchNode[]&gt; {
+   const params = new URLSearchParams()
+   if (repoPath) params.set(&#39;repo_path&#39;, repoPath)
+ 
+   const response = await api.get&lt;ApiResponse&lt;BranchNode[]&gt;&gt;(
+     &#96;/branches/graph?${params.toString()}&#96;
+   )
+ 
+   if (response.data.success &amp;&amp; response.data.data) {
+     return response.data.data
+   }
+ 
+   throw new Error(response.data.error || &#39;Failed to fetch branch graph&#39;)
+ }
+ 
+ export function createWebSocket(repoPath?: string): WebSocket {
+   const wsProtocol = window.location.protocol === &#39;https:&#39; ? &#39;wss:&#39; : &#39;ws:&#39;
+   const wsHost = window.location.hostname
+   const wsPort = &#39;3001&#39; // Backend WebSocket port
+   
+   const params = new URLSearchParams()
+   if (repoPath) params.set(&#39;repo_path&#39;, repoPath)
+   
+   const wsUrl = &#96;${wsProtocol}//${wsHost}:${wsPort}/api/realtime?${params.toString()}&#96;
+   return new WebSocket(wsUrl)
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
+ import { useRef, useMemo } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { Text, Line } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ import { useCommits } from &#39;../hooks/useGitData&#39;
+ 
+ interface CommitGraph3DProps {
+   repoPath?: string
+ }
+ 
+ export default function CommitGraph3D({ repoPath }: CommitGraph3DProps) {
+   const { data: commits, isLoading, error } = useCommits(repoPath)
+   const groupRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+ 
+   // Gentle rotation animation
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (groupRef.current) {
+       groupRef.current.rotation.y += 0.001
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   // Normalize coordinates for better visualization
+   const normalizedCommits = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     if (!commits || commits.length === 0) return []
+ 
+     const minY = Math.min(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.y))
+     const maxY = Math.max(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.y))
+     const timeRange = maxY - minY || 1
+ 
+     return commits.map((commit) =&gt; ({
+       ...commit,
+       // Normalize time to 0-100 range
+       normalizedY: ((commit.y - minY) / timeRange) * 100,
+     }))
+   }, [commits])
+ 
+   // Create connections between commits and their parents
+   const commitConnections = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     if (!normalizedCommits.length) return []
+ 
+     const commitMap = new Map(normalizedCommits.map((c) =&gt; [c.sha, c]))
+     const connections: Array&lt;{
+       from: [number, number, number]
+       to: [number, number, number]
+     }&gt; = []
+ 
+     normalizedCommits.forEach((commit) =&gt; {
+       commit.parents.forEach((parentSha) =&gt; {
+         const parent = commitMap.get(parentSha)
+         if (parent) {
+           connections.push({
+             from: [commit.x, commit.normalizedY, commit.z],
+             to: [parent.x, parent.normalizedY, parent.z],
+           })
+         }
+       })
+     })
+ 
+     return connections
+   }, [normalizedCommits])
+ 
+   if (isLoading) {
+     return null
+   }
+ 
+   if (error) {
+     return (
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 0, 0]} fontSize={2} color=&quot;red&quot;&gt;
+         Error loading commits
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   if (!normalizedCommits.length) {
+     return (
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 0, 0]} fontSize={1.5} color=&quot;yellow&quot;&gt;
+         No commits found
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;group ref={groupRef}&gt;
+       {/* Render commit nodes */}
+       {normalizedCommits.map((commit, index) =&gt; (
+         &lt;group
+           key={commit.sha}
+           position={[commit.x, commit.normalizedY, commit.z]}
+         &gt;
+           &lt;mesh&gt;
+             &lt;sphereGeometry args={[0.5, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+             &lt;meshStandardMaterial
+               color={commit.color}
+               emissive={commit.color}
+               emissiveIntensity={0.3}
+             /&gt;
+           &lt;/mesh&gt;
+ 
+           {/* Commit message on hover (simplified) */}
+           {index % 10 === 0 &amp;&amp; (
+             &lt;Text
+               position={[0, 1.5, 0]}
+               fontSize={0.3}
+               color=&quot;white&quot;
+               anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+               anchorY=&quot;middle&quot;
+               maxWidth={10}
+             &gt;
+               {commit.message.substring(0, 30)}
+             &lt;/Text&gt;
+           )}
+         &lt;/group&gt;
+       ))}
+ 
+       {/* Render connections between commits */}
+       {commitConnections.map((connection, index) =&gt; (
+         &lt;Line
+           key={&#96;line-${index}&#96;}
+           points={[connection.from, connection.to]}
+           color=&quot;rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)&quot;
+           lineWidth={1}
+           dashed={false}
+         /&gt;
+       ))}
+ 
+       {/* Axis labels */}
+       &lt;Text position={[0, -5, 0]} fontSize={1} color=&quot;white&quot;&gt;
+         Branch Axis
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 110, 0]} fontSize={1} color=&quot;white&quot;&gt;
+         Time Axis â†’
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
```

```diff
+ import { useRef, useMemo } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { Text } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ import { useFileHeatmap } from &#39;../hooks/useGitData&#39;
+ 
+ interface FileHeatMapProps {
+   repoPath?: string
+ }
+ 
+ export default function FileHeatMap({ repoPath }: FileHeatMapProps) {
+   const { data: fileStats, isLoading, error } = useFileHeatmap(repoPath)
+   const groupRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+ 
+   // Create heatmap visualization
+   const heatmapData = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     if (!fileStats || fileStats.length === 0) return []
+ 
+     const gridSize = Math.ceil(Math.sqrt(fileStats.length))
+     
+     return fileStats.map((file, index) =&gt; {
+       const x = (index % gridSize) * 2
+       const z = Math.floor(index / gridSize) * 2
+       const y = file.heat_level * 10 // Height based on heat level
+ 
+       // Color from blue (cold) to red (hot)
+       const color = new THREE.Color()
+       color.setHSL(0.6 - file.heat_level * 0.6, 1, 0.5)
+ 
+       return {
+         ...file,
+         position: [x - gridSize, y, z - gridSize] as [number, number, number],
+         color: color.getHex(),
+       }
+     })
+   }, [fileStats])
+ 
+   if (isLoading) {
+     return null
+   }
+ 
+   if (error) {
+     return (
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 0, 0]} fontSize={2} color=&quot;red&quot;&gt;
+         Error loading file stats
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   if (!heatmapData.length) {
+     return (
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 0, 0]} fontSize={1.5} color=&quot;yellow&quot;&gt;
+         No file data found
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;group ref={groupRef} position={[20, 0, 0]}&gt;
+       {heatmapData.map((file) =&gt; (
+         &lt;group key={file.path} position={file.position}&gt;
+           {/* File box */}
+           &lt;mesh&gt;
+             &lt;boxGeometry args={[1.5, file.position[1] || 0.5, 1.5]} /&gt;
+             &lt;meshStandardMaterial
+               color={file.color}
+               emissive={file.color}
+               emissiveIntensity={0.2}
+               transparent
+               opacity={0.8}
+             /&gt;
+           &lt;/mesh&gt;
+ 
+           {/* File path label (for significant files) */}
+           {file.heat_level &gt; 0.5 &amp;&amp; (
+             &lt;Text
+               position={[0, (file.position[1] || 0) + 1, 0]}
+               fontSize={0.2}
+               color=&quot;white&quot;
+               anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+               anchorY=&quot;bottom&quot;
+               maxWidth={3}
+             &gt;
+               {file.path.split(&#39;/&#39;).pop() || file.path}
+             &lt;/Text&gt;
+           )}
+         &lt;/group&gt;
+       ))}
+ 
+       {/* Legend */}
+       &lt;Text position={[0, -3, 0]} fontSize={0.8} color=&quot;white&quot;&gt;
```

```diff
+           &lt;/mesh&gt;

+           &lt;Text
+             position={[0, 2, 0]}
+             fontSize={0.5}
+             color={branch.is_active ? &#39;#10b981&#39; : &#39;white&#39;}
+             anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+             anchorY=&quot;bottom&quot;
+           &gt;
+             {branch.name}
+           &lt;/Text&gt;
+ 
+           {/* Merge count indicator */}
+           {branch.merge_count &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; (
+             &lt;Text
+               position={[0, -1.5, 0]}
+               fontSize={0.3}
+               color=&quot;#fbbf24&quot;
+               anchorX=&quot;center&quot;
+               anchorY=&quot;top&quot;

+               {branch.merge_count} merges
+             &lt;/Text&gt;

+       {/* Render connections */}
```

```diff
+             }

+             console.error(&#39;Failed to parse WebSocket message:&#39;, error)
+           }
+         }
+ 
+         ws.onerror = (error) =&gt; {
+           console.error(&#39;WebSocket error:&#39;, error)
+         }
+ 
+         ws.onclose = () =&gt; {
+           console.log(&#39;ğŸ”Œ WebSocket disconnected&#39;)
+           setIsConnected(false)
+ 
+           // Attempt to reconnect after 5 seconds
+           reconnectTimeout = setTimeout(() =&gt; {
+             console.log(&#39;ğŸ”„ Attempting to reconnect...&#39;)
+             connect()
+           }, 5000)
+         }
+       } catch (error) {
+         console.error(&#39;Failed to create WebSocket:&#39;, error)
+         setIsConnected(false)
+       }
+     }
+ 
+     connect()
+ 
+     return () =&gt; {
+       if (ws) {
+         ws.close()
+       }
+       if (reconnectTimeout) {
+         clearTimeout(reconnectTimeout)
+       }
+     }
+   }, [repoPath, addEvent])
+ 
+   if (events.length === 0 &amp;&amp; !isConnected) {
+     return null
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;realtime-monitor&quot;&gt;
+       &lt;div className=&quot;monitor-header&quot;&gt;
```

```diff
+ # Codex Repository Visualizer
+ 
+ Kamui4d-style 3D repository visualization powered by Rust + React + Three.js
+ 
+ ## ğŸ¨ Features
+ 
+ ### 3D/4D Commit History
+ - **X-axis**: Branch separation
+ - **Y-axis**: Time (commit timestamp)
+ - **Z-axis**: Depth (parent-child relationships)
+ - **Color**: Author differentiation
+ - Interactive navigation with mouse controls
+ 
+ ### File Change Heatmap
+ - Hot/cold visualization of file modifications
+ - Change frequency represented by height
+ - Color gradation from blue (cold) to red (hot)
+ - File size correlation
+ 
+ ### Branch Structure
+ - 3D branch topology
+ - Active branch highlighting
+ - Merge point visualization
+ - Branch lifespan statistics
+ 
+ ### Real-time Monitoring
+ - WebSocket-based live updates
+ - New commit notifications
+ - File change tracking
+ - Collaborative visualization for team development
+ 
+ ## ğŸš€ Quick Start
+ 
+ ### Prerequisites
+ 
+ - **Rust** (2024 edition or later)
+ - **Node.js** (v18+ recommended)
+ - **Git** repository to visualize
+ 
+ ### Backend Setup
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd extensions/codex-viz-web/backend
+ 
+ # Build and run
+ cargo run
+ 
+ # Server starts on http://127.0.0.1:3001
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Frontend Setup
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ cd extensions/codex-viz-web/frontend
+ 
+ # Install dependencies
+ npm install
+ 
+ # Start development server
+ npm run dev
+ 
+ # Frontend starts on http://localhost:3000
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Access
+ 
+ Open your browser to **http://localhost:3000**
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“– Usage
+ 
+ ### Basic Workflow
+ 
+ 1. **Start Backend**: Run the Rust API server
+ 2. **Start Frontend**: Launch the React app
+ 3. **Select View Mode**:
+    - ğŸ“Š **Commits**: 3D/4D commit history
+    - ğŸ”¥ **Heatmap**: File change statistics
+    - ğŸŒ¿ **Branches**: Branch structure
+    - ğŸŒ **All**: Combined view
+ 4. **Specify Repository** (optional): Leave empty for current directory
+ 5. **Interact**:
+    - **Mouse drag**: Rotate view
+    - **Scroll**: Zoom in/out
+    - **Real-time panel**: Monitor live updates
+ 
+ ### API Endpoints
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Get 3D commit history (last 1000 commits)
+ curl &quot;http://localhost:3001/api/commits?limit=1000&quot;
+ 
+ # Get file change heatmap
+ curl &quot;http://localhost:3001/api/files/heatmap?limit=1000&quot;
+ 
+ # Get branch structure
+ curl &quot;http://localhost:3001/api/branches/graph&quot;
+ 
+ # WebSocket for real-time updates
+ ws://localhost:3001/api/realtime
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Custom Repository Path
+ 
+ Add &#96;?repo_path=/path/to/repo&#96; to API requests:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ curl &quot;http://localhost:3001/api/commits?repo_path=/home/user/projects/myrepo&quot;
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ Or use the frontend control panel to specify the path.
+ 
+ ## ğŸ—ï¸ Architecture
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ codex-viz-web/
+ â”œâ”€â”€ backend/            # Rust API server
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ src/
+ â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ api/        # REST endpoints
+ â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ git/        # Git analysis engine
+ â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ types.rs    # Data structures
+ â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.rs     # Server entry
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ Cargo.toml
+ â””â”€â”€ frontend/           # React + Three.js
+     â”œâ”€â”€ src/
+     â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ components/ # 3D visualization components
+     â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ hooks/      # Data fetching hooks
+     â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ lib/        # API client
+     â”‚   â””â”€â”€ main.tsx    # App entry
+     â””â”€â”€ package.json
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Tech Stack
+ 
+ **Backend (Rust)**:
+ - axum (Web framework)
+ - git2 (Git operations)
+ - tokio-tungstenite (WebSocket)
+ - notify (File system watcher)
+ - serde_json (JSON serialization)
+ 
+ **Frontend (React + TypeScript)**:
+ - React 18
+ - Three.js + React Three Fiber
+ - @react-three/drei (Helpers)
+ - @react-three/postprocessing (Effects)
+ - TanStack Query (Data fetching)
+ - Vite (Build tool)
+ 
+ ## ğŸ¯ Performance Optimizations
+ 
+ ### Large Repositories
+ 
+ The visualizer handles large repositories efficiently:
+ 
+ 1. **Commit Limit**: Default 1000 commits (configurable)
+ 2. **Instanced Rendering**: Three.js InstancedMesh for performance
+ 3. **Level of Detail (LOD)**: Simplified rendering for distant objects
+ 4. **Virtual Scrolling**: Efficient event list rendering
+ 5. **Debounced File Watching**: Prevents event flooding
+ 
+ ### Recommended Limits
+ 
+ | Repository Size | Commit Limit | Expected Performance |
+ |----------------|--------------|---------------------|
+ | Small (&lt;1000)  | 1000         | Instant |
+ | Medium (1K-10K)| 1000-5000    | 1-3 seconds |
+ | Large (&gt;10K)   | 5000         | 3-10 seconds |
+ 
+ ## ğŸ”§ Configuration
+ 
+ ### Backend
+ 
+ Edit &#96;backend/Cargo.toml&#96; to adjust dependencies.
+ 
+ Server port: Change &#96;127.0.0.1:3001&#96; in &#96;main.rs&#96;.
+ 
+ ### Frontend
+ 
+ Edit &#96;frontend/vite.config.ts&#96; to change port or proxy settings.
+ 
+ API base URL: Modify &#96;frontend/src/lib/api.ts&#96;.
+ 
+ ## ğŸ› Troubleshooting
+ 
+ ### Backend fails to start
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Check Rust installation
+ cargo --version
+ 
+ # Clean and rebuild
+ cargo clean
+ cargo build
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Frontend build errors
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Clear node_modules
+ rm -rf node_modules
+ npm install
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### WebSocket connection fails
+ 
+ - Ensure backend is running on port 3001
+ - Check firewall settings
+ - Verify CORS configuration in &#96;main.rs&#96;
+ 
+ ### No commits displayed
+ 
+ - Ensure you&#39;re in a Git repository
+ - Check repository path in control panel
+ - Verify backend logs for errors
+ 
+ ## ğŸš€ Future Enhancements
+ 
+ - [ ] **Performance Profiling**: Integrated Chrome DevTools
+ - [ ] **Export Features**: Screenshots, video recording, data export
+ - [ ] **Advanced Filters**: Date range, author, file type
+ - [ ] **Collaborative Mode**: Multi-user visualization
+ - [ ] **Plugin System**: Custom visualization extensions
+ - [ ] **Mobile Support**: Touch controls and responsive design
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“ License
+ 
+ Same as parent project (Apache 2.0)
+ 
+ ## ğŸ™ Acknowledgments
+ 
+ - Inspired by [Kamui4d](https://github.com/kamui4d/kamui4d)
+ - Built on [Gource](https://gource.io/) concepts
+ - Powered by [React Three Fiber](https://docs.pmnd.rs/react-three-fiber/)
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“§ Support
+ 
+ For issues and questions, see the main Codex project README.
+

+
```

```diff
+   { key: &#39;s&#39;, ctrl: true, description: &#39;Take Screenshot (Future)&#39;, action: &#39;take-screenshot&#39; },
+ ]
+ 
+ export function useKeyboardShortcuts(
+   handlers: Partial&lt;Record&lt;ShortcutAction, () =&gt; void&gt;&gt;
+ ) {
+   const handleKeyDown = useCallback(
+     (event: KeyboardEvent) =&gt; {
+       // Check if we&#39;re in an input field
+       const target = event.target as HTMLElement
+       if (
+         target.tagName === &#39;INPUT&#39; ||
+         target.tagName === &#39;TEXTAREA&#39; ||
+         target.isContentEditable
+       ) {
+         return
+       }
+ 
+       // Find matching shortcut
+       const shortcut = shortcuts.find((s) =&gt; {
+         const keyMatch = s.key.toLowerCase() === event.key.toLowerCase()
+         const ctrlMatch = s.ctrl ? event.ctrlKey || event.metaKey : !event.ctrlKey &amp;&amp; !event.metaKey
+         const altMatch = s.alt ? event.altKey : !event.altKey
+         const shiftMatch = s.shift ? event.shiftKey : !event.shiftKey
+ 
+         return keyMatch &amp;&amp; ctrlMatch &amp;&amp; altMatch &amp;&amp; shiftMatch
+       })
+ 
+       if (shortcut &amp;&amp; handlers[shortcut.action]) {
+         event.preventDefault()
+         handlers[shortcut.action]!()
+       }
+     },
+     [handlers]
+   )
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     window.addEventListener(&#39;keydown&#39;, handleKeyDown)
+     return () =&gt; window.removeEventListener(&#39;keydown&#39;, handleKeyDown)
+   }, [handleKeyDown])
+ }
+ 
+ export function getShortcutDisplay(shortcut: Shortcut): string {
+   const parts: string[] = []
+   if (shortcut.ctrl) parts.push(&#39;Ctrl&#39;)
+   if (shortcut.alt) parts.push(&#39;Alt&#39;)
+   if (shortcut.shift) parts.push(&#39;Shift&#39;)
+   parts.push(shortcut.key.toUpperCase())
+   return parts.join(&#39;+&#39;)
+ }
+ 
```

```diff
+ import { useEffect, useState } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { useFrame, useThree } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import &#39;./PerformanceMonitor.css&#39;
+ 
+ interface PerformanceMetrics {
+   fps: number
+   memory: number
+   drawCalls: number
+   triangles: number
+   gpuTime: number
+ }
+ 
+ export default function PerformanceMonitor() {
+   const { gl } = useThree()
+   const [metrics, setMetrics] = useState&lt;PerformanceMetrics&gt;({
+     fps: 0,
+     memory: 0,
+     drawCalls: 0,
+     triangles: 0,
+     gpuTime: 0,
+   })
+ 
+   let frameCount = 0
+   let lastTime = performance.now()
+ 
+   useFrame(() =&gt; {
+     frameCount++
+     const currentTime = performance.now()
+     const elapsed = currentTime - lastTime
+ 
+     if (elapsed &gt;= 1000) {
+       const fps = Math.round((frameCount * 1000) / elapsed)
+       const info = gl.info
+ 
+       setMetrics({
+         fps,
+         memory: (performance as any).memory
+           ? Math.round((performance as any).memory.usedJSHeapSize / 1048576)
+           : 0,
+         drawCalls: info.render.calls,
+         triangles: info.render.triangles,
+         gpuTime: 0, // WebGL doesn&#39;t expose GPU time directly
+       })
+ 
+       frameCount = 0
+       lastTime = currentTime
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   const getFpsColor = (fps: number) =&gt; {
+     if (fps &gt;= 55) return &#39;#22c55e&#39;
+     if (fps &gt;= 30) return &#39;#eab308&#39;
+     return &#39;#ef4444&#39;
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;performance-monitor&quot;&gt;
+       &lt;div className=&quot;perf-header&quot;&gt;
+         &lt;span className=&quot;perf-title&quot;&gt;âš¡ Performance&lt;/span&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+       
+       &lt;div className=&quot;perf-metrics&quot;&gt;
+         &lt;div className=&quot;perf-metric&quot;&gt;
+           &lt;span className=&quot;perf-label&quot;&gt;FPS&lt;/span&gt;
+           &lt;span 
+             className=&quot;perf-value perf-value-large&quot;
+             style={{ color: getFpsColor(metrics.fps) }}
+           &gt;
+             {metrics.fps}
+           &lt;/span&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+         &lt;div className=&quot;perf-metric&quot;&gt;
+           &lt;span className=&quot;perf-label&quot;&gt;Memory&lt;/span&gt;
+           &lt;span className=&quot;perf-value&quot;&gt;{metrics.memory} MB&lt;/span&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+         &lt;div className=&quot;perf-metric&quot;&gt;
+           &lt;span className=&quot;perf-label&quot;&gt;Draw Calls&lt;/span&gt;
+           &lt;span className=&quot;perf-value&quot;&gt;{metrics.drawCalls}&lt;/span&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+         &lt;div className=&quot;perf-metric&quot;&gt;
+           &lt;span className=&quot;perf-label&quot;&gt;Triangles&lt;/span&gt;
+           &lt;span className=&quot;perf-value&quot;&gt;
+             {(metrics.triangles / 1000).toFixed(1)}K
+           &lt;/span&gt;
+         &lt;/div&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+ 
+       &lt;div className=&quot;perf-bar&quot;&gt;
+         &lt;div 
+           className=&quot;perf-bar-fill&quot;
+           style={{ 
+             width: &#96;${Math.min(100, (metrics.fps / 60) * 100)}%&#96;,
+             background: getFpsColor(metrics.fps),
+           }}
+         /&gt;
+       &lt;/div&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
```

```diff
+ import { useRef, useMemo, useEffect } from &#39;react&#39;
+ import { useFrame } from &#39;@react-three/fiber&#39;
+ import { Text, Line } from &#39;@react-three/drei&#39;
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ import { useCommits } from &#39;../hooks/useGitData&#39;
+ 
+ interface CommitGraph3DOptimizedProps {
+   repoPath?: string
+ }
+ 
+ export default function CommitGraph3DOptimized({ repoPath }: CommitGraph3DOptimizedProps) {
+   const { data: commits, isLoading, error } = useCommits(repoPath)
+   const groupRef = useRef&lt;THREE.Group&gt;(null)
+   const instancedMeshRef = useRef&lt;THREE.InstancedMesh&gt;(null)
+ 
+   // Normalize coordinates for better visualization
+   const normalizedCommits = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     if (!commits || commits.length === 0) return []
+ 
+     const minY = Math.min(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.y))
+     const maxY = Math.max(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.y))
+     const timeRange = maxY - minY || 1
+ 
+     return commits.map((commit) =&gt; ({
+       ...commit,
+       normalizedY: ((commit.y - minY) / timeRange) * 100,
+     }))
+   }, [commits])
+ 
+   // GPU-optimized instanced rendering
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     if (!instancedMeshRef.current || normalizedCommits.length === 0) return
+ 
+     const mesh = instancedMeshRef.current
+     const tempObject = new THREE.Object3D()
+     const tempColor = new THREE.Color()
+ 
+     normalizedCommits.forEach((commit, i) =&gt; {
+       // Set position
+       tempObject.position.set(commit.x, commit.normalizedY, commit.z)
+       
+       // Set scale (slightly random for visual interest)
+       const scale = 0.5 + Math.random() * 0.2
+       tempObject.scale.set(scale, scale, scale)
+       
+       // Update matrix
+       tempObject.updateMatrix()
+       mesh.setMatrixAt(i, tempObject.matrix)
+ 
+       // Set color
+       tempColor.set(commit.color)
+       mesh.setColorAt(i, tempColor)
+     })
+ 
+     mesh.instanceMatrix.needsUpdate = true
+     if (mesh.instanceColor) {
+       mesh.instanceColor.needsUpdate = true
+     }
+   }, [normalizedCommits])
+ 
+   // Gentle rotation animation
+   useFrame((state) =&gt; {
+     if (groupRef.current) {
+       groupRef.current.rotation.y += 0.001
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   // Create connections between commits (using geometry pooling)
+   const commitConnections = useMemo(() =&gt; {
+     if (!normalizedCommits.length) return []
+ 
+     const commitMap = new Map(normalizedCommits.map((c) =&gt; [c.sha, c]))
+     const connections: Array&lt;{
+       from: [number, number, number]
+       to: [number, number, number]
+     }&gt; = []
+ 
+     // Limit connections for performance
+     const maxConnections = 500
+     let connectionCount = 0
+ 
+     for (const commit of normalizedCommits) {
+       if (connectionCount &gt;= maxConnections) break
+ 
+       for (const parentSha of commit.parents) {
+         const parent = commitMap.get(parentSha)
+         if (parent) {
+           connections.push({
+             from: [commit.x, commit.normalizedY, commit.z],
+             to: [parent.x, parent.normalizedY, parent.z],
+           })
+           connectionCount++
+           if (connectionCount &gt;= maxConnections) break
+         }
+       }
+     }
+ 
+     return connections
+   }, [normalizedCommits])
+ 
+   if (isLoading) {
+     return null
+   }
+ 
+   if (error) {
+     return (
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 0, 0]} fontSize={2} color=&quot;red&quot;&gt;
+         Error loading commits
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   if (!normalizedCommits.length) {
+     return (
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 0, 0]} fontSize={1.5} color=&quot;yellow&quot;&gt;
+         No commits found
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;group ref={groupRef}&gt;
+       {/* GPU-accelerated instanced rendering for commits */}
+       &lt;instancedMesh
+         ref={instancedMeshRef}
+         args={[undefined, undefined, normalizedCommits.length]}
+         frustumCulled={true}
+       &gt;
+         &lt;sphereGeometry args={[0.5, 16, 16]} /&gt;
+         &lt;meshStandardMaterial
+           toneMapped={false}
+           emissive=&quot;#38bdf8&quot;
+           emissiveIntensity={0.3}
+         /&gt;
+       &lt;/instancedMesh&gt;
+ 
+       {/* Render connections (batched) */}
+       {commitConnections.map((connection, index) =&gt; (
+         &lt;Line
+           key={&#96;line-${index}&#96;}
+           points={[connection.from, connection.to]}
+           color=&quot;rgba(56, 189, 248, 0.3)&quot;
+           lineWidth={1}
+           dashed={false}
+         /&gt;
+       ))}
+ 
+       {/* Axis labels */}
+       &lt;Text position={[0, -5, 0]} fontSize={1} color=&quot;white&quot;&gt;
+         Branch Axis
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+       &lt;Text position={[0, 110, 0]} fontSize={1} color=&quot;white&quot;&gt;
+         Time Axis â†’
+       &lt;/Text&gt;
+     &lt;/group&gt;
+   )
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ /**
+  * GPU Optimization Utilities
+  * Best practices for WebGL/Three.js performance
+  */
+ 
+ import * as THREE from &#39;three&#39;
+ 
+ /**
+  * Check if GPU acceleration is available and performant
+  */
+ export function checkGPUCapabilities(): {
+   isSupported: boolean
+   renderer: string
+   maxTextureSize: number
+   maxVertexUniforms: number
+   isHighPerformance: boolean
+ } {
+   const canvas = document.createElement(&#39;canvas&#39;)
+   const gl = canvas.getContext(&#39;webgl2&#39;) || canvas.getContext(&#39;webgl&#39;)
+ 
+   if (!gl) {
+     return {
+       isSupported: false,
+       renderer: &#39;unknown&#39;,
+       maxTextureSize: 0,
+       maxVertexUniforms: 0,
+       isHighPerformance: false,
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   const debugInfo = gl.getExtension(&#39;WEBGL_debug_renderer_info&#39;)
+   const renderer = debugInfo
+     ? gl.getParameter(debugInfo.UNMASKED_RENDERER_WEBGL)
+     : &#39;unknown&#39;
+ 
+   const maxTextureSize = gl.getParameter(gl.MAX_TEXTURE_SIZE)
+   const maxVertexUniforms = gl.getParameter(gl.MAX_VERTEX_UNIFORM_VECTORS)
+ 
+   // Check if it&#39;s a high-performance GPU
+   const isHighPerformance =
+     !renderer.toLowerCase().includes(&#39;intel&#39;) &amp;&amp;
+     maxTextureSize &gt;= 8192 &amp;&amp;
+     maxVertexUniforms &gt;= 256
+ 
+   return {
+     isSupported: true,
+     renderer,
+     maxTextureSize,
+     maxVertexUniforms,
+     isHighPerformance,
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Configure renderer for optimal performance
+  */
+ export function configureHighPerformanceRenderer(
+   renderer: THREE.WebGLRenderer
+ ): void {
+   // Enable hardware acceleration hints
+   renderer.setPixelRatio(Math.min(window.devicePixelRatio, 2))
+ 
+   // Optimize shadow maps
+   renderer.shadowMap.enabled = false // Disable for performance
+   renderer.shadowMap.type = THREE.PCFSoftShadowMap
+ 
+   // Enable frustum culling
+   renderer.info.autoReset = true
+ 
+   // Use optimal color space
+   renderer.outputColorSpace = THREE.SRGBColorSpace
+ 
+   // Optimize canvas
+   const canvas = renderer.domElement
+   canvas.style.imageRendering = &#39;auto&#39;
+   canvas.style.webkitFontSmoothing = &#39;antialiased&#39;
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Create geometry with optimal buffer attributes
+  */
+ export function createOptimizedBufferGeometry(
+   positions: Float32Array,
+   normals?: Float32Array,
+   colors?: Float32Array
+ ): THREE.BufferGeometry {
+   const geometry = new THREE.BufferGeometry()
+ 
+   geometry.setAttribute(&#39;position&#39;, new THREE.BufferAttribute(positions, 3))
+ 
+   if (normals) {
+     geometry.setAttribute(&#39;normal&#39;, new THREE.BufferAttribute(normals, 3))
+   } else {
+     geometry.computeVertexNormals()
+   }
+ 
+   if (colors) {
+     geometry.setAttribute(&#39;color&#39;, new THREE.BufferAttribute(colors, 3))
+   }
+ 
+   // Compute bounding sphere for frustum culling
+   geometry.computeBoundingSphere()
+ 
+   return geometry
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Create instanced mesh for large numbers of identical objects
+  */
+ export function createInstancedMesh(
+   geometry: THREE.BufferGeometry,
+   material: THREE.Material,
+   count: number,
+   positions: Float32Array,
+   colors?: Float32Array
+ ): THREE.InstancedMesh {
+   const mesh = new THREE.InstancedMesh(geometry, material, count)
+ 
+   const matrix = new THREE.Matrix4()
+   const color = new THREE.Color()
+ 
+   for (let i = 0; i &lt; count; i++) {
+     // Set position
+     matrix.setPosition(
+       positions[i * 3],
+       positions[i * 3 + 1],
+       positions[i * 3 + 2]
+     )
+     mesh.setMatrixAt(i, matrix)
+ 
+     // Set color if provided
+     if (colors) {
+       color.setRGB(colors[i * 3], colors[i * 3 + 1], colors[i * 3 + 2])
+       mesh.setColorAt(i, color)
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   mesh.instanceMatrix.needsUpdate = true
+   if (mesh.instanceColor) {
+     mesh.instanceColor.needsUpdate = true
+   }
+ 
+   // Enable frustum culling per instance
+   mesh.frustumCulled = true
+ 
+   return mesh
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Level of Detail (LOD) helper
+  */
+ export function createLOD(
+   positions: Float32Array,
+   highDetailGeometry: THREE.BufferGeometry,
+   midDetailGeometry: THREE.BufferGeometry,
+   lowDetailGeometry: THREE.BufferGeometry,
+   material: THREE.Material
+ ): THREE.LOD {
+   const lod = new THREE.LOD()
+ 
+   // High detail (close)
+   const highMesh = new THREE.Mesh(highDetailGeometry, material)
+   lod.addLevel(highMesh, 0)
+ 
+   // Mid detail (medium distance)
+   const midMesh = new THREE.Mesh(midDetailGeometry, material)
+   lod.addLevel(midMesh, 50)
+ 
+   // Low detail (far)
+   const lowMesh = new THREE.Mesh(lowDetailGeometry, material)
+   lod.addLevel(lowMesh, 100)
+ 
+   return lod
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Dispose geometry and material properly to free GPU memory
+  */
+ export function disposeObject(object: THREE.Object3D): void {
+   object.traverse((child) =&gt; {
+     if (child instanceof THREE.Mesh) {
+       child.geometry?.dispose()
+ 
+       if (Array.isArray(child.material)) {
+         child.material.forEach((material) =&gt; material.dispose())
+       } else {
+         child.material?.dispose()
+       }
+     }
+   })
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Monitor GPU memory usage (approximation)
+  */
+ export function estimateGPUMemoryUsage(scene: THREE.Scene): {
+   geometries: number
+   textures: number
+   total: number
+ } {
+   let geometryMemory = 0
+   let textureMemory = 0
+ 
+   scene.traverse((object) =&gt; {
+     if (object instanceof THREE.Mesh) {
+       const geometry = object.geometry
+       if (geometry) {
+         // Estimate geometry memory
+         const positionAttr = geometry.getAttribute(&#39;position&#39;)
+         if (positionAttr) {
+           geometryMemory += positionAttr.array.byteLength
+         }
+       }
+ 
+       // Estimate texture memory
+       const material = object.material as THREE.Material
+       if (material &amp;&amp; &#39;map&#39; in material) {
+         const texture = (material as any).map as THREE.Texture
+         if (texture &amp;&amp; texture.image) {
+           const { width, height } = texture.image
+           textureMemory += width * height * 4 // RGBA
+         }
+       }
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   return {
+     geometries: geometryMemory / 1024 / 1024, // MB
+     textures: textureMemory / 1024 / 1024, // MB
+     total: (geometryMemory + textureMemory) / 1024 / 1024, // MB
+   }
+ }
+
```

```diff
+   const [isExiting, setIsExiting] = useState(false)
+ 
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     const timer = setTimeout(() =&gt; {
+       setIsExiting(true)
+       setTimeout(onClose, 300) // Wait for exit animation
+     }, duration)
+ 
+     return () =&gt; clearTimeout(timer)
+   }, [duration, onClose])
+ 
+   const icons = {
+     success: &#39;âœ“&#39;,
+     error: &#39;âœ•&#39;,
+     info: &#39;â„¹&#39;,
+     warning: &#39;âš &#39;,
+   }
+ 
+   return (
+     &lt;div 
+       className={&#96;toast toast-${type} ${isExiting ? &#39;toast-exit&#39; : &#39;&#39;}&#96;}
+       role=&quot;alert&quot;
+       aria-live=&quot;polite&quot;
+     &gt;
+       &lt;span className=&quot;toast-icon&quot;&gt;{icons[type]}&lt;/span&gt;
+       &lt;span className=&quot;toast-message&quot;&gt;{message}&lt;/span&gt;
+       &lt;button 
+         className=&quot;toast-close&quot;
+         onClick={() =&gt; {
+           setIsExiting(true)
+           setTimeout(onClose, 300)
+         }}
+         aria-label=&quot;Close notification&quot;
+       &gt;
+         âœ•
+       &lt;/button&gt;
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
+ 
+ // Toast Container Component
+ interface ToastContainerProps {
+   toasts: Array&lt;{ id: string; message: string; type: ToastType }&gt;
+   onRemove: (id: string) =&gt; void
+ }
+ 
+ export function ToastContainer({ toasts, onRemove }: ToastContainerProps) {
+   return (
+     &lt;div className=&quot;toast-container&quot;&gt;
+       {toasts.map((toast) =&gt; (
+         &lt;Toast
+           key={toast.id}
+           message={toast.message}
+           type={toast.type}
+           onClose={() =&gt; onRemove(toast.id)}
+         /&gt;
+       ))}
+     &lt;/div&gt;
+   )
+ }
```

```diff
+ /**
+  * Git Analyzer Web Worker
+  * Offloads heavy git data processing from main thread
+  */
+ 
+ import type { Commit3D } from &#39;../types&#39;
+ 
+ // Worker message types
+ export type WorkerMessage =
+   | { type: &#39;analyze&#39;; data: Commit3D[] }
+   | { type: &#39;normalize&#39;; data: Commit3D[] }
+   | { type: &#39;filter&#39;; data: { commits: Commit3D[]; filter: FilterOptions } }
+ 
+ export type WorkerResponse =
+   | { type: &#39;analyzed&#39;; data: ProcessedData }
+   | { type: &#39;normalized&#39;; data: Commit3D[] }
+   | { type: &#39;filtered&#39;; data: Commit3D[] }
+   | { type: &#39;error&#39;; error: string }
+   | { type: &#39;progress&#39;; progress: number }
+ 
+ export interface FilterOptions {
+   authors?: string[]
+   branches?: string[]
+   dateFrom?: string
+   dateTo?: string
+   searchText?: string
+ }
+ 
+ export interface ProcessedData {
+   commits: Commit3D[]
+   statistics: {
+     totalCommits: number
+     uniqueAuthors: number
+     branches: string[]
+     dateRange: { min: number; max: number }
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Main worker logic
+ self.onmessage = (event: MessageEvent&lt;WorkerMessage&gt;) =&gt; {
+   try {
+     const message = event.data
+ 
+     switch (message.type) {
+       case &#39;analyze&#39;:
+         analyzeCommits(message.data)
+         break
+ 
+       case &#39;normalize&#39;:
+         normalizeCommits(message.data)
+         break
+ 
+       case &#39;filter&#39;:
+         filterCommits(message.data.commits, message.data.filter)
+         break
+ 
+       default:
+         postMessage({
+           type: &#39;error&#39;,
+           error: &#39;Unknown message type&#39;,
+         } as WorkerResponse)
+     }
+   } catch (error) {
+     postMessage({
+       type: &#39;error&#39;,
+       error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
+     } as WorkerResponse)
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Analyze commits and extract statistics
+  */
+ function analyzeCommits(commits: Commit3D[]): void {
+   const total = commits.length
+   let processed = 0
+ 
+   // Extract unique authors
+   const authors = new Set&lt;string&gt;()
+   const branches = new Set&lt;string&gt;()
+   let minDate = Infinity
+   let maxDate = -Infinity
+ 
+   for (const commit of commits) {
+     authors.add(commit.author_email)
+     branches.add(commit.branch)
+     
+     const timestamp = new Date(commit.timestamp).getTime()
+     minDate = Math.min(minDate, timestamp)
+     maxDate = Math.max(maxDate, timestamp)
+ 
+     processed++
+     if (processed % 100 === 0) {
+       postMessage({
+         type: &#39;progress&#39;,
+         progress: (processed / total) * 100,
+       } as WorkerResponse)
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   postMessage({
+     type: &#39;analyzed&#39;,
+     data: {
+       commits,
+       statistics: {
+         totalCommits: total,
+         uniqueAuthors: authors.size,
+         branches: Array.from(branches),
+         dateRange: { min: minDate, max: maxDate },
+       },
+     },
+   } as WorkerResponse)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Normalize commit coordinates for visualization
+  */
+ function normalizeCommits(commits: Commit3D[]): void {
+   if (commits.length === 0) {
+     postMessage({
+       type: &#39;normalized&#39;,
+       data: [],
+     } as WorkerResponse)
+     return
+   }
+ 
+   const minY = Math.min(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.y))
+   const maxY = Math.max(...commits.map((c) =&gt; c.y))
+   const timeRange = maxY - minY || 1
+ 
+   const normalized = commits.map((commit) =&gt; ({
+     ...commit,
+     normalizedY: ((commit.y - minY) / timeRange) * 100,
+   }))
+ 
+   postMessage({
+     type: &#39;normalized&#39;,
+     data: normalized,
+   } as WorkerResponse)
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Filter commits based on criteria
+  */
+ function filterCommits(commits: Commit3D[], filter: FilterOptions): void {
+   let filtered = commits
+ 
+   // Filter by authors
+   if (filter.authors &amp;&amp; filter.authors.length &gt; 0) {
+     filtered = filtered.filter((c) =&gt;
+       filter.authors!.includes(c.author_email)
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   // Filter by branches
+   if (filter.branches &amp;&amp; filter.branches.length &gt; 0) {
+     filtered = filtered.filter((c) =&gt;
+       filter.branches!.includes(c.branch)
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   // Filter by date range
+   if (filter.dateFrom) {
+     const fromTime = new Date(filter.dateFrom).getTime()
+     filtered = filtered.filter(
+       (c) =&gt; new Date(c.timestamp).getTime() &gt;= fromTime
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   if (filter.dateTo) {
+     const toTime = new Date(filter.dateTo).getTime()
+     filtered = filtered.filter(
+       (c) =&gt; new Date(c.timestamp).getTime() &lt;= toTime
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   // Filter by search text
+   if (filter.searchText &amp;&amp; filter.searchText.length &gt; 0) {
+     const searchLower = filter.searchText.toLowerCase()
+     filtered = filtered.filter(
+       (c) =&gt;
+         c.message.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
+         c.author.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower) ||
+         c.sha.toLowerCase().includes(searchLower)
+     )
+   }
+ 
+   postMessage({
+     type: &#39;filtered&#39;,
+     data: filtered,
+   } as WorkerResponse)
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ import type { WorkerMessage, WorkerResponse } from &#39;../workers/gitAnalyzer.worker&#39;
+ 
+ export function useWebWorker&lt;T = any&gt;() {
+   const workerRef = useRef&lt;Worker | null&gt;(null)
+   const [isProcessing, setIsProcessing] = useState(false)
+   const [progress, setProgress] = useState(0)
+   const [error, setError] = useState&lt;string | null&gt;(null)
+ 
+   // Initialize worker
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     try {
+       workerRef.current = new Worker(
+         new URL(&#39;../workers/gitAnalyzer.worker.ts&#39;, import.meta.url),
+         { type: &#39;module&#39; }
+       )
+ 
+       workerRef.current.onerror = (event) =&gt; {
+         console.error(&#39;Worker error:&#39;, event)
+         setError(&#39;Worker initialization failed&#39;)
+         setIsProcessing(false)
+       }
+     } catch (err) {
+       console.error(&#39;Failed to create worker:&#39;, err)
+       setError(&#39;Worker creation failed&#39;)
+     }
+ 
+     return () =&gt; {
+       workerRef.current?.terminate()
+     }
+   }, [])
+ 
+   // Send message to worker
+   const postMessage = useCallback(
+     (message: WorkerMessage): Promise&lt;T&gt; =&gt; {
+       return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {
+         if (!workerRef.current) {
+           reject(new Error(&#39;Worker not initialized&#39;))
+           return
+         }
+ 
+         setIsProcessing(true)
+         setProgress(0)
+         setError(null)
+ 
+         const handleMessage = (event: MessageEvent&lt;WorkerResponse&gt;) =&gt; {
+           const response = event.data
+ 
+           switch (response.type) {
+             case &#39;progress&#39;:
+               setProgress(response.progress)
+               break
+ 
+             case &#39;error&#39;:
+               setError(response.error)
+               setIsProcessing(false)
+               reject(new Error(response.error))
+               workerRef.current?.removeEventListener(&#39;message&#39;, handleMessage)
+               break
+ 
+             default:
+               // Success response
+               setIsProcessing(false)
+               setProgress(100)
+               resolve(response.data as T)
+               workerRef.current?.removeEventListener(&#39;message&#39;, handleMessage)
+               break
+           }
+         }
+ 
+         workerRef.current.addEventListener(&#39;message&#39;, handleMessage)
+         workerRef.current.postMessage(message)
+ 
+         // Timeout after 30 seconds
+         setTimeout(() =&gt; {
+           if (isProcessing) {
+             setError(&#39;Worker timeout&#39;)
+             setIsProcessing(false)
+             reject(new Error(&#39;Worker timeout&#39;))
+           }
+         }, 30000)
+       })
+     },
+     [isProcessing]
+   )
+ 
+   return {
+     postMessage,
+     isProcessing,
+     progress,
+     error,
+   }
+ }
+
```

```diff
+ import { useState, useEffect, useCallback, useRef } from &#39;react&#39;
+ 
+ interface StreamingOptions {
+   chunkSize?: number
+   onProgress?: (loaded: number, total: number) =&gt; void
+   onError?: (error: Error) =&gt; void
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Hook for streaming large datasets in chunks
+  * Prevents memory overflow and UI freezing
+  */
+ export function useStreamingData&lt;T&gt;(
+   url: string,
+   options: StreamingOptions = {}
+ ) {
+   const { chunkSize = 100, onProgress, onError } = options
+ 
+   const [data, setData] = useState&lt;T[]&gt;([])
+   const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(false)
+   const [progress, setProgress] = useState(0)
+   const [error, setError] = useState&lt;Error | null&gt;(null)
+   const abortControllerRef = useRef&lt;AbortController | null&gt;(null)
+ 
+   const loadData = useCallback(async () =&gt; {
+     setIsLoading(true)
+     setError(null)
+     setProgress(0)
+     setData([])
+ 
+     // Create abort controller for cancellation
+     abortControllerRef.current = new AbortController()
+ 
+     try {
+       const response = await fetch(url, {
+         signal: abortControllerRef.current.signal,
+       })
+ 
+       if (!response.ok) {
+         throw new Error(&#96;HTTP error! status: ${response.status}&#96;)
+       }
+ 
+       const contentLength = response.headers.get(&#39;content-length&#39;)
+       const total = contentLength ? parseInt(contentLength, 10) : 0
+ 
+       const reader = response.body?.getReader()
+       if (!reader) {
+         throw new Error(&#39;ReadableStream not supported&#39;)
+       }
+ 
+       const decoder = new TextDecoder()
+       let buffer = &#39;&#39;
+       let loaded = 0
+       let chunk: T[] = []
+ 
+       while (true) {
+         const { done, value } = await reader.read()
+ 
+         if (done) break
+ 
+         loaded += value.byteLength
+ 
+         // Update progress
+         if (total &gt; 0) {
+           const progressPercent = (loaded / total) * 100
+           setProgress(progressPercent)
+           onProgress?.(loaded, total)
+         }
+ 
+         // Decode chunk
+         buffer += decoder.decode(value, { stream: true })
+ 
+         // Parse JSON lines
+         const lines = buffer.split(&#39;\n&#39;)
+         buffer = lines.pop() || &#39;&#39; // Keep incomplete line in buffer
+ 
+         for (const line of lines) {
+           if (line.trim()) {
+             try {
+               const item = JSON.parse(line) as T
+               chunk.push(item)
+ 
+               // Emit chunk when size reached
+               if (chunk.length &gt;= chunkSize) {
+                 setData((prev) =&gt; [...prev, ...chunk])
+                 chunk = []
+                 // Allow UI to update
+                 await new Promise((resolve) =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 0))
+               }
+             } catch (parseError) {
+               console.warn(&#39;Failed to parse line:&#39;, line, parseError)
+             }
+           }
+         }
+       }
+ 
+       // Add remaining items
+       if (chunk.length &gt; 0) {
+         setData((prev) =&gt; [...prev, ...chunk])
+       }
+ 
+       setProgress(100)
+     } catch (err) {
+       if (err instanceof Error) {
+         if (err.name !== &#39;AbortError&#39;) {
+           setError(err)
+           onError?.(err)
+         }
+       }
+     } finally {
+       setIsLoading(false)
+     }
+   }, [url, chunkSize, onProgress, onError])
+ 
+   // Cancel loading
+   const cancel = useCallback(() =&gt; {
+     abortControllerRef.current?.abort()
+     setIsLoading(false)
+   }, [])
+ 
+   // Auto-load on mount
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     loadData()
+ 
+     return () =&gt; {
+       abortControllerRef.current?.abort()
+     }
+   }, [loadData])
+ 
+   return {
+     data,
+     isLoading,
+     progress,
+     error,
+     reload: loadData,
+     cancel,
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * Hook for paginated data loading
+  * Alternative to streaming for backends that don&#39;t support streaming
+  */
+ export function usePaginatedData&lt;T&gt;(
+   baseUrl: string,
+   pageSize: number = 100
+ ) {
+   const [data, setData] = useState&lt;T[]&gt;([])
+   const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(false)
+   const [hasMore, setHasMore] = useState(true)
+   const [page, setPage] = useState(0)
+   const [error, setError] = useState&lt;Error | null&gt;(null)
+ 
+   const loadMore = useCallback(async () =&gt; {
+     if (isLoading || !hasMore) return
+ 
+     setIsLoading(true)
+     setError(null)
+ 
+     try {
+       const url = &#96;${baseUrl}?page=${page}&amp;limit=${pageSize}&#96;
+       const response = await fetch(url)
+ 
+       if (!response.ok) {
+         throw new Error(&#96;HTTP error! status: ${response.status}&#96;)
+       }
+ 
+       const result = await response.json()
+       const items = result.data || result
+ 
+       if (items.length === 0 || items.length &lt; pageSize) {
+         setHasMore(false)
+       }
+ 
+       setData((prev) =&gt; [...prev, ...items])
+       setPage((prev) =&gt; prev + 1)
+     } catch (err) {
+       if (err instanceof Error) {
+         setError(err)
+       }
+     } finally {
+       setIsLoading(false)
+     }
+   }, [baseUrl, page, pageSize, isLoading, hasMore])
+ 
+   // Load first page on mount
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     loadMore()
+   }, []) // Only on mount
+ 
+   const reset = useCallback(() =&gt; {
+     setData([])
+     setPage(0)
+     setHasMore(true)
+     setError(null)
+   }, [])
+ 
+   return {
+     data,
+     isLoading,
+     hasMore,
+     error,
+     loadMore,
+     reset,
+   }
+ }
+
```
