+ use crate::git::GitAnalyzer;
+ use crate::types::{ApiResponse, Commit3D};
+ use axum::{
+     extract::Query,
+     http::StatusCode,
+     response::{
+         sse::{Event, KeepAlive},
+         IntoResponse, Sse,
+     },
+ };
+ use futures::stream::{self, Stream};
+ use serde::Deserialize;
+ use std::convert::Infallible;
+ use std::env;
+ use std::time::Duration;
+ 
+ #[derive(Deserialize)]
+ pub struct StreamingQuery {
+     #[serde(default = &quot;default_chunk_size&quot;)]
+     chunk_size: usize,
+     #[serde(default)]
+     repo_path: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ fn default_chunk_size() -&gt; usize {
+     100
+ }
+ 
+ /// GET /api/commits/stream - Stream commits in chunks via Server-Sent Events
+ pub async fn stream_commits(
+     Query(params): Query&lt;StreamingQuery&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; Result&lt;impl IntoResponse, (StatusCode, String)&gt; {
+     let repo_path = params
+         .repo_path
+         .unwrap_or_else(|| env::current_dir().unwrap().to_string_lossy().to_string());
+ 
+     let mut analyzer = GitAnalyzer::open(&amp;repo_path)
+         .map_err(|e| (StatusCode::BAD_REQUEST, format!(&quot;Repository error: {}&quot;, e)))?;
+ 
+     let commits = analyzer
+         .analyze_commits(None)
+         .map_err(|e| (StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR, format!(&quot;Analysis error: {}&quot;, e)))?;
+ 
+     tracing::info!(
+         &quot;ğŸ“¡ Streaming {} commits from {} in chunks of {}&quot;,
+         commits.len(),
+         repo_path,
+         params.chunk_size
+     );
+ 
+     // Create SSE stream
+     let stream = create_commit_stream(commits, params.chunk_size);
+ 
+     Ok(Sse::new(stream).keep_alive(KeepAlive::default()))
+ }
+ 
+ /// Create a stream that emits commits in chunks
+ fn create_commit_stream(
+     commits: Vec&lt;Commit3D&gt;,
+     chunk_size: usize,
+ ) -&gt; impl Stream&lt;Item = Result&lt;Event, Infallible&gt;&gt; {
+     let total = commits.len();
+     let chunks: Vec&lt;Vec&lt;Commit3D&gt;&gt; = commits
+         .chunks(chunk_size)
+         .map(|chunk| chunk.to_vec())
+         .collect();
+ 
+     stream::iter(chunks.into_iter().enumerate().map(move |(i, chunk)| {
+         let progress = ((i + 1) * chunk_size).min(total);
+         let percent = (progress as f32 / total as f32 * 100.0) as u32;
+ 
+         let data = serde_json::json!({
+             &quot;chunk&quot;: chunk,
+             &quot;progress&quot;: {
+                 &quot;current&quot;: progress,
+                 &quot;total&quot;: total,
+                 &quot;percent&quot;: percent,
+             }
+         });
+ 
+         Ok(Event::default()
+             .json_data(data)
+             .expect(&quot;Failed to serialize&quot;))
+     }))
+ }
+ 
+ /// GET /api/commits/paginated - Get commits with pagination
+ #[derive(Deserialize)]
+ pub struct PaginationQuery {
+     #[serde(default)]
+     page: usize,
+     #[serde(default = &quot;default_page_size&quot;)]
+     limit: usize,
+     #[serde(default)]
+     repo_path: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ fn default_page_size() -&gt; usize {
+     100
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn paginated_commits(
+     Query(params): Query&lt;PaginationQuery&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; impl IntoResponse {
+     let repo_path = params
+         .repo_path
+         .unwrap_or_else(|| env::current_dir().unwrap().to_string_lossy().to_string());
+ 
+     match GitAnalyzer::open(&amp;repo_path) {
+         Ok(mut analyzer) =&gt; match analyzer.analyze_commits(None) {
+             Ok(all_commits) =&gt; {
+                 let total = all_commits.len();
+                 let start = params.page * params.limit;
+                 let end = (start + params.limit).min(total);
+ 
+                 if start &gt;= total {
+                     return (
+                         StatusCode::OK,
+                         axum::Json(ApiResponse::success(Vec::&lt;Commit3D&gt;::new())),
+                     );
+                 }
+ 
+                 let page_commits = all_commits[start..end].to_vec();
+ 
+                 tracing::info!(
+                     &quot;ğŸ“„ Serving page {} ({}-{} of {}) from {}&quot;,
+                     params.page,
+                     start,
+                     end,
+                     total,
+                     repo_path
+                 );
+ 
+                 (StatusCode::OK, axum::Json(ApiResponse::success(page_commits)))
+             }
+             Err(e) =&gt; {
+                 tracing::error!(&quot;Failed to analyze commits: {}&quot;, e);
+                 (
+                     StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
+                     axum::Json(ApiResponse::&lt;Vec&lt;Commit3D&gt;&gt;::error(format!(
+                         &quot;Analysis error: {}&quot;,
+                         e
+                     ))),
+                 )
+             }
+         },
+         Err(e) =&gt; {
+             tracing::error!(&quot;Failed to open repository: {}&quot;, e);
+             (
+                 StatusCode::BAD_REQUEST,
+                 axum::Json(ApiResponse::&lt;Vec&lt;Commit3D&gt;&gt;::error(format!(
+                     &quot;Repository error: {}&quot;,
+                     e
+                 ))),
+             )
+         }
+     }
+ }
+

+   // Playback animation

+ import { useState, useEffect, useCallback } from &#39;react&#39;
+ 
+ export interface Bookmark {
+   id: string
+   sha: string
+   message: string
+   timestamp: string
+   createdAt: string
+   notes?: string
+ }
+ 
+ const STORAGE_KEY = &#39;codex-viz-bookmarks&#39;
+ 
+ export function useBookmarks() {
+   const [bookmarks, setBookmarks] = useState&lt;Bookmark[]&gt;([])
+ 
+   // Load bookmarks from localStorage
+   useEffect(() =&gt; {
+     try {
+       const stored = localStorage.getItem(STORAGE_KEY)
+       if (stored) {
+         const parsed = JSON.parse(stored)
+         setBookmarks(parsed)
+       }
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error(&#39;Failed to load bookmarks:&#39;, error)
+     }
+   }, [])
+ 
+   // Save bookmarks to localStorage
+   const saveBookmarks = useCallback((newBookmarks: Bookmark[]) =&gt; {
+     try {
+       localStorage.setItem(STORAGE_KEY, JSON.stringify(newBookmarks))
+       setBookmarks(newBookmarks)
+     } catch (error) {
+       console.error(&#39;Failed to save bookmarks:&#39;, error)
+     }
+   }, [])
+ 
+   const addBookmark = useCallback(
+     (bookmark: Omit&lt;Bookmark, &#39;id&#39; | &#39;createdAt&#39;&gt;) =&gt; {
+       const newBookmark: Bookmark = {
+         ...bookmark,
+         id: &#96;${bookmark.sha}-${Date.now()}&#96;,
+         createdAt: new Date().toISOString(),
+       }
+ 
+       // Check if already bookmarked
+       if (bookmarks.find((b) =&gt; b.sha === bookmark.sha)) {
+         return false
+       }
+ 
+       saveBookmarks([...bookmarks, newBookmark])
+       return true
+     },
+     [bookmarks, saveBookmarks]
+   )
+ 
+   const removeBookmark = useCallback(
+     (id: string) =&gt; {
+       saveBookmarks(bookmarks.filter((b) =&gt; b.id !== id))
+     },
+     [bookmarks, saveBookmarks]
+   )
+ 
+   const updateBookmark = useCallback(
+     (id: string, updates: Partial&lt;Bookmark&gt;) =&gt; {
+       saveBookmarks(
+         bookmarks.map((b) =&gt; (b.id === id ? { ...b, ...updates } : b))
+       )
+     },
+     [bookmarks, saveBookmarks]
+   )
+ 
+   const isBookmarked = useCallback(
+     (sha: string) =&gt; {
+       return bookmarks.some((b) =&gt; b.sha === sha)
+     },
+     [bookmarks]
+   )
+ 
+   const clearBookmarks = useCallback(() =&gt; {
+     saveBookmarks([])
+   }, [saveBookmarks])
+ 
+   return {
+     bookmarks,
+     addBookmark,
+     removeBookmark,
+     updateBookmark,
+     isBookmarked,
+     clearBookmarks,
+   }
+ }
+ 
```

+ import { app, BrowserWindow, Tray, Menu, ipcMain, shell, nativeImage } from &#39;electron&#39;
+ import { join } from &#39;path&#39;
+ import { spawn, ChildProcess } from &#39;child_process&#39;
+ import Store from &#39;electron-store&#39;
+ import { autoUpdater } from &#39;electron-updater&#39;
+ 
+ // Persistent store
+ const store = new Store({
+   defaults: {
+     windowBounds: { width: 1400, height: 900 },
+     recentRepos: [],
+     settings: {
+       autoStart: true,
+       minimizeToTray: true,
+       notifications: true,
+       theme: &#39;dark&#39;,
+     },
+   },
+ })
+ 
+ let mainWindow: BrowserWindow | null = null
+ let tray: Tray | null = null
+ let backendProcess: ChildProcess | null = null
+ 
+ // Backend server management
+ function startBackendServer() {
+   const backendPath = join(__dirname, &#39;../../backend/target/release/codex-viz-backend&#39;)
+   
+   backendProcess = spawn(backendPath, [], {
+     stdio: &#39;inherit&#39;,
+     shell: process.platform === &#39;win32&#39;,
+   })
+ 
+   backendProcess.on(&#39;error&#39;, (error) =&gt; {
+     console.error(&#39;Backend server error:&#39;, error)
+   })
+ 
+   backendProcess.on(&#39;exit&#39;, (code) =&gt; {
+     console.log(&#96;Backend server exited with code ${code}&#96;)
+   })
+ 
+   console.log(&#39;ğŸ¦€ Backend server started&#39;)
+ }
+ 
+ function stopBackendServer() {
+   if (backendProcess) {
+     backendProcess.kill()
+     backendProcess = null
+     console.log(&#39;ğŸ›‘ Backend server stopped&#39;)
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ // Create main window
+ function createWindow() {
+   const bounds = store.get(&#39;windowBounds&#39;) as { width: number; height: number }
+ 
+   mainWindow = new BrowserWindow({
+     width: bounds.width,
+     height: bounds.height,
+     minWidth: 1024,
+     minHeight: 768,
+     backgroundColor: &#39;#0a0a0f&#39;,
+     webPreferences: {
+       preload: join(__dirname, &#39;../preload/index.js&#39;),
+       nodeIntegration: false,
+       contextIsolation: true,
+     },
+     title: &#39;Codex Repository Visualizer&#39;,
+     show: false, // Show after ready-to-show
+   })
+ 
+   // Load frontend
+   if (process.env.VITE_DEV_SERVER_URL) {
+     mainWindow.loadURL(process.env.VITE_DEV_SERVER_URL)
+   } else {
+     mainWindow.loadFile(join(__dirname, &#39;../renderer/index.html&#39;))
+   }
+ 
+   // Show window when ready
+   mainWindow.once(&#39;ready-to-show&#39;, () =&gt; {
+     mainWindow?.show()
+   })
+ 
+   // Save window bounds on resize
+   mainWindow.on(&#39;resize&#39;, () =&gt; {
+     const bounds = mainWindow?.getBounds()
+     if (bounds) {
+       store.set(&#39;windowBounds&#39;, { width: bounds.width, height: bounds.height })
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   // Handle minimize to tray
+   mainWindow.on(&#39;close&#39;, (event) =&gt; {
+     const settings = store.get(&#39;settings&#39;) as { minimizeToTray: boolean }
+     
+     if (settings.minimizeToTray &amp;&amp; !app.isQuitting) {
+       event.preventDefault()
+       mainWindow?.hide()
+     }
+   })
+ 
+   // Open external links in browser
+   mainWindow.webContents.setWindowOpenHandler(({ url }) =&gt; {
+     shell.openExternal(url)
+     return { action: &#39;deny&#39; }
+   })
+ }
+ 
+ // Create system tray
+ function createTray() {
+   const iconPath = join(__dirname, &#39;../../resources/tray-icon.png&#39;)
+   const trayIcon = nativeImage.createFromPath(iconPath)
+   
+   tray = new Tray(trayIcon.resize({ width: 16, height: 16 }))
+ 
+   const contextMenu = Menu.buildFromTemplate([
+     {
+       label: &#39;Show Codex Viz&#39;,
+       click: () =&gt; {
+         mainWindow?.show()
+         mainWindow?.focus()
+       },
+     },
+     { type: &#39;separator&#39; },
+     {
+       label: &#39;Recent Repositories&#39;,
+       submenu: getRecentReposMenu(),
+     },
+     { type: &#39;separator&#39; },
+     {
+       label: &#39;Settings&#39;,
+       submenu: [
+         {
+           label: &#39;Auto-start on login&#39;,
+           type: &#39;checkbox&#39;,
+           checked: (store.get(&#39;settings&#39;) as { autoStart: boolean }).autoStart,
+           click: (item) =&gt; {
+             store.set(&#39;settings.autoStart&#39;, item.checked)
+             app.setLoginItemSettings({
+               openAtLogin: item.checked,
+             })
+           },
+         },
+         {
+           label: &#39;Minimize to tray&#39;,
+           type: &#39;checkbox&#39;,
+           checked: (store.get(&#39;settings&#39;) as { minimizeToTray: boolean }).minimizeToTray,
+           click: (item) =&gt; {
+             store.set(&#39;settings.minimizeToTray&#39;, item.checked)
+           },
+         },
+         {
+           label: &#39;Enable notifications&#39;,
+           type: &#39;checkbox&#39;,
+           checked: (store.get(&#39;settings&#39;) as { notifications: boolean }).notifications,
+           click: (item) =&gt; {
+             store.set(&#39;settings.notifications&#39;, item.checked)
+           },
+         },
+       ],
+     },
+     { type: &#39;separator&#39; },
+     {
+       label: &#39;Quit&#39;,
+       click: () =&gt; {
+         app.isQuitting = true
+         app.quit()
+       },
+     },
+   ])
+ 
+   tray.setToolTip(&#39;Codex Repository Visualizer&#39;)
+   tray.setContextMenu(contextMenu)
+ 
+   tray.on(&#39;double-click&#39;, () =&gt; {
+     mainWindow?.show()
+     mainWindow?.focus()
+   })
+ }
+ 
+ function getRecentReposMenu(): Electron.MenuItemConstructorOptions[] {
+   const recentRepos = store.get(&#39;recentRepos&#39;) as string[]
+ 
+   if (recentRepos.length === 0) {
+     return [{ label: &#39;No recent repositories&#39;, enabled: false }]
+   }
+ 
+   return recentRepos.slice(0, 5).map((repo) =&gt; ({
+     label: repo,
+     click: () =&gt; {
+       mainWindow?.webContents.send(&#39;open-repo&#39;, repo)
+       mainWindow?.show()
+       mainWindow?.focus()
+     },
+   }))
+ }
+ 
+ // IPC Handlers
+ ipcMain.handle(&#39;get-store&#39;, (_, key: string) =&gt; {
+   return store.get(key)
+ })
+ 
+ ipcMain.handle(&#39;set-store&#39;, (_, key: string, value: any) =&gt; {
+   store.set(key, value)
+ })
+ 
+ ipcMain.handle(&#39;add-recent-repo&#39;, (_, repo: string) =&gt; {
+   const recentRepos = store.get(&#39;recentRepos&#39;) as string[]
+   const updated = [repo, ...recentRepos.filter((r) =&gt; r !== repo)].slice(0, 10)
+   store.set(&#39;recentRepos&#39;, updated)
+   
+   // Update tray menu
+   if (tray) {
+     const contextMenu = tray.getContextMenu()
+     if (contextMenu) {
+       // Rebuild menu with updated recent repos
+       createTray()
+     }
+   }
+ })
+ 
+ ipcMain.handle(&#39;show-notification&#39;, (_, options: { title: string; body: string }) =&gt; {
+   const settings = store.get(&#39;settings&#39;) as { notifications: boolean }
+   
+   if (settings.notifications &amp;&amp; mainWindow) {
+     new Notification({
+       title: options.title,
+       body: options.body,
+     }).show()
+   }
+ })
+ 
+ ipcMain.handle(&#39;minimize-to-tray&#39;, () =&gt; {
+   mainWindow?.hide()
+ })
+ 
+ // Auto-updater
+ autoUpdater.on(&#39;update-available&#39;, () =&gt; {
+   mainWindow?.webContents.send(&#39;update-available&#39;)
+ })
+ 
+ autoUpdater.on(&#39;update-downloaded&#39;, () =&gt; {
+   mainWindow?.webContents.send(&#39;update-downloaded&#39;)
+ })
+ 
+ ipcMain.handle(&#39;install-update&#39;, () =&gt; {
+   autoUpdater.quitAndInstall()
+ })
+ 
+ // App lifecycle
+ app.whenReady().then(() =&gt; {
+   // Start backend server
+   startBackendServer()
+ 
+   // Create window and tray
+   createWindow()
+   createTray()
+ 
+   // Check for updates
+   autoUpdater.checkForUpdatesAndNotify()
+ 
+   // Auto-start settings
+   const settings = store.get(&#39;settings&#39;) as { autoStart: boolean }
+   app.setLoginItemSettings({
+     openAtLogin: settings.autoStart,
+   })
+ })
+ 
+ app.on(&#39;window-all-closed&#39;, () =&gt; {
+   const settings = store.get(&#39;settings&#39;) as { minimizeToTray: boolean }
+   
+   if (!settings.minimizeToTray || process.platform !== &#39;darwin&#39;) {
+     stopBackendServer()
+     app.quit()
+   }
+ })
+ 
+ app.on(&#39;activate&#39;, () =&gt; {
+   if (BrowserWindow.getAllWindows().length === 0) {
+     createWindow()
+   } else {
+     mainWindow?.show()
+   }
+ })
+ 
+ app.on(&#39;before-quit&#39;, () =&gt; {
+   app.isQuitting = true
+   stopBackendServer()
+ })
+ 
+ // Extend app with custom property
+ declare module &#39;electron&#39; {
+   interface App {
+     isQuitting?: boolean
+   }
+ }
+

+ import { contextBridge, ipcRenderer } from &#39;electron&#39;
+ 
+ // Expose protected methods to renderer process
+ contextBridge.exposeInMainWorld(&#39;electronAPI&#39;, {
+   // Store operations
+   getStore: (key: string) =&gt; ipcRenderer.invoke(&#39;get-store&#39;, key),
+   setStore: (key: string, value: any) =&gt; ipcRenderer.invoke(&#39;set-store&#39;, key, value),
+   
+   // Repository operations
+   addRecentRepo: (repo: string) =&gt; ipcRenderer.invoke(&#39;add-recent-repo&#39;, repo),
+   
+   // Notifications
+   showNotification: (options: { title: string; body: string }) =&gt;
+     ipcRenderer.invoke(&#39;show-notification&#39;, options),
+   
+   // Window controls
+   minimizeToTray: () =&gt; ipcRenderer.invoke(&#39;minimize-to-tray&#39;),
+   
+   // Auto-updater
+   installUpdate: () =&gt; ipcRenderer.invoke(&#39;install-update&#39;),
+   
+   // Event listeners
+   onOpenRepo: (callback: (repo: string) =&gt; void) =&gt; {
+     ipcRenderer.on(&#39;open-repo&#39;, (_, repo) =&gt; callback(repo))
+   },
+   
+   onUpdateAvailable: (callback: () =&gt; void) =&gt; {
+     ipcRenderer.on(&#39;update-available&#39;, callback)
+   },
+   
+   onUpdateDownloaded: (callback: () =&gt; void) =&gt; {
+     ipcRenderer.on(&#39;update-downloaded&#39;, callback)
+   },
+ })
+ 
+ // Type declarations
+ export interface ElectronAPI {
+   getStore: (key: string) =&gt; Promise&lt;any&gt;
+   setStore: (key: string, value: any) =&gt; Promise&lt;void&gt;
+   addRecentRepo: (repo: string) =&gt; Promise&lt;void&gt;

+ use axum::{
+     extract::{Path, Query, State},
+     http::StatusCode,
+     response::{IntoResponse, Json},
+ };
+ use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
+ use std::collections::HashMap;
+ use std::sync::{Arc, RwLock};
+ use chrono::{DateTime, Utc};
+ 
+ /// Comment on a specific commit
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct Comment {
+     pub id: String,
+     pub commit_sha: String,
+     pub author: String,
+     pub content: String,
+     pub created_at: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+     pub updated_at: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// Shared view state for collaboration
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct SharedView {
+     pub id: String,
+     pub created_by: String,
+     pub repo_path: String,
+     pub view_mode: String,
+     pub filters: ViewFilters,
+     pub camera_position: [f32; 3],
+     pub created_at: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ViewFilters {
+     pub authors: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub branches: Vec&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub date_from: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+     pub date_to: Option&lt;String&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// In-memory storage (should be replaced with database in production)
+ #[derive(Clone)]
+ pub struct CollaborationState {
+     pub comments: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;String, Vec&lt;Comment&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+     pub shared_views: Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;HashMap&lt;String, SharedView&gt;&gt;&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ impl CollaborationState {
+     pub fn new() -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             comments: Arc::new(RwLock::new(HashMap::new())),
+             shared_views: Arc::new(RwLock::new(HashMap::new())),
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ // API Handlers
+ 
+ /// POST /api/comments/:commit_sha - Add comment to commit
+ #[derive(Deserialize)]
+ pub struct AddCommentRequest {
+     author: String,
+     content: String,
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn add_comment(
+     State(state): State&lt;CollaborationState&gt;,
+     Path(commit_sha): Path&lt;String&gt;,
+     Json(payload): Json&lt;AddCommentRequest&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; impl IntoResponse {
+     let comment = Comment {
+         id: uuid::Uuid::new_v4().to_string(),
+         commit_sha: commit_sha.clone(),
+         author: payload.author,
+         content: payload.content,
+         created_at: Utc::now(),
+         updated_at: Utc::now(),
+     };
+ 
+     let mut comments = state.comments.write().unwrap();
+     comments
+         .entry(commit_sha)
+         .or_insert_with(Vec::new)
+         .push(comment.clone());
+ 
+     tracing::info!(&quot;ğŸ’¬ Comment added: {}&quot;, comment.id);
+ 
+     (StatusCode::CREATED, Json(comment))
+ }
+ 
+ /// GET /api/comments/:commit_sha - Get comments for commit
+ pub async fn get_comments(
+     State(state): State&lt;CollaborationState&gt;,
+     Path(commit_sha): Path&lt;String&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; impl IntoResponse {
+     let comments = state.comments.read().unwrap();
+     let commit_comments = comments.get(&amp;commit_sha).cloned().unwrap_or_default();
+ 
+     (StatusCode::OK, Json(commit_comments))
+ }
+ 
+ /// DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id - Delete comment
+ pub async fn delete_comment(
+     State(state): State&lt;CollaborationState&gt;,
+     Path(comment_id): Path&lt;String&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; impl IntoResponse {
+     let mut comments = state.comments.write().unwrap();
+     
+     for commit_comments in comments.values_mut() {
+         commit_comments.retain(|c| c.id != comment_id);
+     }
+ 
+     tracing::info!(&quot;ğŸ—‘ï¸ Comment deleted: {}&quot;, comment_id);
+ 
+     StatusCode::NO_CONTENT
+ }
+ 
+ /// POST /api/views/share - Create shared view
+ #[derive(Deserialize)]
+ pub struct ShareViewRequest {
+     created_by: String,
+     repo_path: String,
+     view_mode: String,
+     filters: ViewFilters,
+     camera_position: [f32; 3],
+ }
+ 
+ pub async fn share_view(
+     State(state): State&lt;CollaborationState&gt;,
+     Json(payload): Json&lt;ShareViewRequest&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; impl IntoResponse {
+     let view_id = generate_short_id();
+     
+     let shared_view = SharedView {
+         id: view_id.clone(),
+         created_by: payload.created_by,
+         repo_path: payload.repo_path,
+         view_mode: payload.view_mode,
+         filters: payload.filters,
+         camera_position: payload.camera_position,
+         created_at: Utc::now(),
+     };
+ 
+     let mut views = state.shared_views.write().unwrap();
+     views.insert(view_id.clone(), shared_view.clone());
+ 
+     tracing::info!(&quot;ğŸ”— Shared view created: {}&quot;, view_id);
+ 
+     (StatusCode::CREATED, Json(shared_view))
+ }
+ 
+ /// GET /api/views/:view_id - Get shared view
+ pub async fn get_shared_view(
+     State(state): State&lt;CollaborationState&gt;,
+     Path(view_id): Path&lt;String&gt;,
+ ) -&gt; impl IntoResponse {
+     let views = state.shared_views.read().unwrap();
+     
+     if let Some(view) = views.get(&amp;view_id) {
+         (StatusCode::OK, Json(view.clone()))
+     } else {
+         (
+             StatusCode::NOT_FOUND,
+             Json(serde_json::json!({ &quot;error&quot;: &quot;View not found&quot; })),
+         )
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Generate short ID for shareable links
+ fn generate_short_id() -&gt; String {
+     use std::collections::hash_map::DefaultHasher;
+     use std::hash::{Hash, Hasher};
+ 
+     let mut hasher = DefaultHasher::new();
+     Utc::now().timestamp_nanos_opt().unwrap_or(0).hash(&amp;mut hasher);
+     
+     let hash = hasher.finish();
+     format!(&quot;{:x}&quot;, hash)[..8].to_string()
+ }
+

+ /*

+  * Kernel Module for AI-optimized memory management
+  * 
+  * Features:
+  * - Pinned memory pool (GPU accessible)

+ MODULE_VERSION(&quot;0.1.0&quot;);

+ // Memory pool configuration
+ #define AI_MEM_POOL_SIZE (256 * 1024 * 1024)  // 256MB
+ #define AI_MEM_BLOCK_SIZE (4 * 1024)          // 4KB blocks

+     void *virt_addr;

+     int num_blocks = AI_MEM_POOL_SIZE / AI_MEM_BLOCK_SIZE;
+     
+     global_pool = kzalloc(sizeof(struct ai_memory_pool), GFP_KERNEL);
+     if (!global_pool)
+         return -ENOMEM;
+     
+     global_pool-&gt;blocks = kzalloc(
+         num_blocks * sizeof(struct ai_memory_block),
+         GFP_KERNEL
+     );
+     if (!global_pool-&gt;blocks) {
+         kfree(global_pool);
+         return -ENOMEM;
+     }
+     
+     global_pool-&gt;num_blocks = num_blocks;
+     spin_lock_init(&amp;global_pool-&gt;lock);
+     atomic_set(&amp;global_pool-&gt;allocated_bytes, 0);
+     
+     // å„ãƒ–ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯ã‚’äº‹å‰ç¢ºä¿ï¼ˆPinned memoryï¼‰
+     for (i = 0; i &lt; num_blocks; i++) {
+         struct page *page = alloc_page(GFP_KERNEL | __GFP_DMA);
+         if (!page) {
+             pr_err(&quot;AI Mem: Failed to allocate block %d\n&quot;, i);
+             continue;
+         }
+         
+         global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].virt_addr = page_address(page);
+         global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].size = AI_MEM_BLOCK_SIZE;
+         global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].is_allocated = false;
+         
+         // ãƒšãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’ãƒ”ãƒ³ç•™ã‚
+         SetPageReserved(page);
+     }
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI Mem: Initialized %d blocks (%zu MB)\n&quot;,
+             num_blocks, AI_MEM_POOL_SIZE / 1024 / 1024);
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Pinned memoryç¢ºä¿
+  */
+ void* ai_alloc_pinned(size_t size)
+ {
+     unsigned long flags;
+     int i;
+     int num_blocks_needed = (size + AI_MEM_BLOCK_SIZE - 1) / AI_MEM_BLOCK_SIZE;
+     void *first_block = NULL;
+     
+     if (!global_pool)
+         return NULL;
+     
+     spin_lock_irqsave(&amp;global_pool-&gt;lock, flags);
+     
+     // é€£ç¶šãƒ–ãƒ­ãƒƒã‚¯æ¤œç´¢
+     for (i = 0; i &lt;= global_pool-&gt;num_blocks - num_blocks_needed; i++) {
+         bool available = true;
+         int j;
+         
+         for (j = 0; j &lt; num_blocks_needed; j++) {
+             if (global_pool-&gt;blocks[i + j].is_allocated) {
+                 available = false;
+                 break;
+             }
+         }
+         
+         if (available) {
+             // ç¢ºä¿
+             for (j = 0; j &lt; num_blocks_needed; j++) {
+                 global_pool-&gt;blocks[i + j].is_allocated = true;
+                 global_pool-&gt;blocks[i + j].owner_pid = current-&gt;pid;
+             }
+             
+             first_block = global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].virt_addr;
+             atomic_add(size, &amp;global_pool-&gt;allocated_bytes);
+             break;
+         }
+     }
+     
+     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&amp;global_pool-&gt;lock, flags);
+     
+     if (first_block) {
+         pr_debug(&quot;AI Mem: Allocated %zu bytes for PID %d\n&quot;, size, current-&gt;pid);
+     } else {
+         pr_warn(&quot;AI Mem: Failed to allocate %zu bytes (OOM)\n&quot;, size);
+     }
+     
+     return first_block;
+ }
+ EXPORT_SYMBOL(ai_alloc_pinned);
+ 
+ /*
+  * Pinned memoryè§£æ”¾
+  */
+ void ai_free_pinned(void *addr)
+ {
+     unsigned long flags;
+     int i;
+     
+     if (!global_pool || !addr)
+         return;
+     
+     spin_lock_irqsave(&amp;global_pool-&gt;lock, flags);
+     
+     for (i = 0; i &lt; global_pool-&gt;num_blocks; i++) {
+         if (global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].virt_addr == addr &amp;&amp;
+             global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].is_allocated) {
+             
+             global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].is_allocated = false;
+             global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].owner_pid = 0;
+             
+             atomic_sub(global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].size, 
+                       &amp;global_pool-&gt;allocated_bytes);
+             
+             pr_debug(&quot;AI Mem: Freed block at index %d\n&quot;, i);
+             break;
+         }
+     }
+     
+     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&amp;global_pool-&gt;lock, flags);
+ }
+ EXPORT_SYMBOL(ai_free_pinned);
+ 
+ /*
+  * /proc/ai_memory çµ±è¨ˆè¡¨ç¤º
+  */
+ static int ai_memory_proc_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
+ {
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;AI Memory Allocator Status\n&quot;);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;===========================\n&quot;);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;Total Pool Size: %zu MB\n&quot;, 
+                AI_MEM_POOL_SIZE / 1024 / 1024);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;Block Size: %zu KB\n&quot;, 
+                AI_MEM_BLOCK_SIZE / 1024);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;Total Blocks: %d\n&quot;, 
+                global_pool ? global_pool-&gt;num_blocks : 0);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;Allocated: %d bytes\n&quot;, 
+                atomic_read(&amp;global_pool-&gt;allocated_bytes));
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ 
+ static int ai_memory_proc_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
+ {
+     return single_open(file, ai_memory_proc_show, NULL);
+ }
+ 
+ static const struct proc_ops ai_memory_proc_ops = {
+     .proc_open = ai_memory_proc_open,
+     .proc_read = seq_read,
+     .proc_lseek = seq_lseek,
+     .proc_release = single_release,
+ };
+ 
+ /*
+  * ãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«åˆæœŸåŒ–
+  */
+ static int __init ai_mem_init(void)
+ {
+     int ret;
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;ğŸš€ AI Memory Allocator: Initializing...\n&quot;);
+     
+     // Memory poolä½œæˆ
+     ret = ai_mem_pool_init();
+     if (ret &lt; 0) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI Mem: Pool initialization failed\n&quot;);
+         return ret;
+     }
+     
+     // /proc ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒªä½œæˆ
+     proc_create(&quot;ai_memory&quot;, 0, NULL, &amp;ai_memory_proc_ops);
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI Memory Allocator: Ready! Check /proc/ai_memory\n&quot;);
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * ãƒ¢ã‚¸ãƒ¥ãƒ¼ãƒ«çµ‚äº†
+  */
+ static void __exit ai_mem_exit(void)
+ {
+     int i;
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI Memory Allocator: Shutting down...\n&quot;);
+     
+     // /proc ã‚¨ãƒ³ãƒˆãƒªå‰Šé™¤
+     remove_proc_entry(&quot;ai_memory&quot;, NULL);
+     
+     // ãƒ¡ãƒ¢ãƒªãƒ—ãƒ¼ãƒ«è§£æ”¾
+     if (global_pool) {
+         for (i = 0; i &lt; global_pool-&gt;num_blocks; i++) {
+             if (global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].virt_addr) {
+                 struct page *page = virt_to_page(
+                     global_pool-&gt;blocks[i].virt_addr
+                 );
+                 ClearPageReserved(page);
+                 __free_page(page);
+             }
+         }
+         
+         kfree(global_pool-&gt;blocks);
+         kfree(global_pool);
+     }
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI Memory Allocator: Stopped\n&quot;);
+ }
+ 
+ module_init(ai_mem_init);
+ module_exit(ai_mem_exit);
+

+

+

+

+     // é–‹å§‹æ™‚åˆ»è¨˜éŒ²
+     bpf_map_update_elem(&amp;inference_start_map, &amp;pid_tgid, &amp;ts, BPF_ANY);

+ }

+ // GPU kernelå®Œäº†æ™‚ã«ãƒˆãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹

+ int trace_cuda_complete(struct pt_regs *ctx)

+     __u64 *start_ts = bpf_map_lookup_elem(&amp;inference_start_map, &amp;pid_tgid);
+

+         __u64 delta_ns = end_ts - *start_ts;
+         __u64 delta_ms = delta_ns / 1000000;  // Convert to ms
+         
+         // ãƒ’ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚°ãƒ©ãƒ ã«è¨˜éŒ²
+         __u64 *count = bpf_map_lookup_elem(&amp;inference_latency_hist, &amp;delta_ms);

@@ -1,1 +1,362 @@
- 
+ /*
+  * AI GPU Direct Access Module
+  * Linux Kernel Module for direct GPU control
+  * 
+  * Features:
+  * - CUDA Driver integration
+  * - Direct DMA transfers
+  * - GPU memory management
+  * - Compute kernel dispatch
+  */
+ 
+ #include &lt;linux/module.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/kernel.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/init.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/pci.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/dma-mapping.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/proc_fs.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/seq_file.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/slab.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;linux/mm.h&gt;
+ 
+ MODULE_LICENSE(&quot;GPL&quot;);
+ MODULE_AUTHOR(&quot;zapabob&quot;);
+ MODULE_DESCRIPTION(&quot;AI GPU Direct Access Module&quot;);
+ MODULE_VERSION(&quot;0.2.0&quot;);
+ 
+ /* GPU device structure */
+ struct ai_gpu_device {
+     struct pci_dev *pdev;
+     void __iomem *mmio_base;
+     dma_addr_t dma_handle;
+     void *dma_buffer;
+     size_t buffer_size;
+     spinlock_t lock;
+     atomic_t ref_count;
+ };
+ 
+ static struct ai_gpu_device *global_gpu_dev = NULL;
+ 
+ /* DMA buffer size: 64MB */
+ #define DMA_BUFFER_SIZE (64 * 1024 * 1024)
+ 
+ /* GPU statistics */
+ struct gpu_stats {
+     atomic64_t transfers_to_gpu;
+     atomic64_t transfers_from_gpu;
+     atomic64_t bytes_to_gpu;
+     atomic64_t bytes_from_gpu;
+     atomic64_t kernel_launches;
+ };
+ 
+ static struct gpu_stats global_stats = {
+     .transfers_to_gpu = ATOMIC64_INIT(0),
+     .transfers_from_gpu = ATOMIC64_INIT(0),
+     .bytes_to_gpu = ATOMIC64_INIT(0),
+     .bytes_from_gpu = ATOMIC64_INIT(0),
+     .kernel_launches = ATOMIC64_INIT(0),
+ };
+ 
+ /*
+  * GPU device initialization
+  */
+ static int ai_gpu_device_init(void)
+ {
+     struct pci_dev *pdev = NULL;
+     int ret;
+     
+     global_gpu_dev = kzalloc(sizeof(struct ai_gpu_device), GFP_KERNEL);
+     if (!global_gpu_dev) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Failed to allocate device structure\n&quot;);
+         return -ENOMEM;
+     }
+     
+     /* Find NVIDIA GPU (vendor ID: 0x10de) */
+     pdev = pci_get_device(0x10de, PCI_ANY_ID, NULL);
+     if (!pdev) {
+         pr_warn(&quot;AI GPU: No NVIDIA GPU found, trying AMD...\n&quot;);
+         /* AMD GPU (vendor ID: 0x1002) */
+         pdev = pci_get_device(0x1002, PCI_ANY_ID, NULL);
+     }
+     
+     if (!pdev) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: No compatible GPU found\n&quot;);
+         kfree(global_gpu_dev);
+         global_gpu_dev = NULL;
+         return -ENODEV;
+     }
+     
+     global_gpu_dev-&gt;pdev = pdev;
+     
+     /* Enable PCI device */
+     ret = pci_enable_device(pdev);
+     if (ret &lt; 0) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Failed to enable PCI device\n&quot;);
+         pci_dev_put(pdev);
+         kfree(global_gpu_dev);
+         global_gpu_dev = NULL;
+         return ret;
+     }
+     
+     /* Set DMA mask for 64-bit addressing */
+     ret = dma_set_mask_and_coherent(&amp;pdev-&gt;dev, DMA_BIT_MASK(64));
+     if (ret &lt; 0) {
+         pr_warn(&quot;AI GPU: 64-bit DMA not available, trying 32-bit\n&quot;);
+         ret = dma_set_mask_and_coherent(&amp;pdev-&gt;dev, DMA_BIT_MASK(32));
+         if (ret &lt; 0) {
+             pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: DMA not available\n&quot;);
+             pci_disable_device(pdev);
+             pci_dev_put(pdev);
+             kfree(global_gpu_dev);
+             global_gpu_dev = NULL;
+             return ret;
+         }
+     }
+     
+     pci_set_master(pdev);
+     
+     /* Allocate DMA buffer */
+     global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_buffer = dma_alloc_coherent(
+         &amp;pdev-&gt;dev,
+         DMA_BUFFER_SIZE,
+         &amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_handle,
+         GFP_KERNEL
+     );
+     
+     if (!global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_buffer) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Failed to allocate DMA buffer\n&quot;);
+         pci_disable_device(pdev);
+         pci_dev_put(pdev);
+         kfree(global_gpu_dev);
+         global_gpu_dev = NULL;
+         return -ENOMEM;
+     }
+     
+     global_gpu_dev-&gt;buffer_size = DMA_BUFFER_SIZE;
+     spin_lock_init(&amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;lock);
+     atomic_set(&amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;ref_count, 0);
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI GPU: Initialized device %04x:%04x (DMA buffer: %zu MB)\n&quot;,
+             pdev-&gt;vendor, pdev-&gt;device, DMA_BUFFER_SIZE / 1024 / 1024);
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * GPU device cleanup
+  */
+ static void ai_gpu_device_cleanup(void)
+ {
+     if (!global_gpu_dev)
+         return;
+     
+     if (global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_buffer) {
+         dma_free_coherent(
+             &amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;pdev-&gt;dev,
+             global_gpu_dev-&gt;buffer_size,
+             global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_buffer,
+             global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_handle
+         );
+     }
+     
+     if (global_gpu_dev-&gt;pdev) {
+         pci_disable_device(global_gpu_dev-&gt;pdev);
+         pci_dev_put(global_gpu_dev-&gt;pdev);
+     }
+     
+     kfree(global_gpu_dev);
+     global_gpu_dev = NULL;
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI GPU: Device cleaned up\n&quot;);
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * DMA transfer to GPU
+  */
+ int ai_dma_to_gpu(const void *src, size_t size, dma_addr_t gpu_addr)
+ {
+     unsigned long flags;
+     
+     if (!global_gpu_dev || !src || size == 0) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Invalid DMA parameters\n&quot;);
+         return -EINVAL;
+     }
+     
+     if (size &gt; DMA_BUFFER_SIZE) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Transfer size exceeds buffer (%zu &gt; %zu)\n&quot;,
+                size, DMA_BUFFER_SIZE);
+         return -E2BIG;
+     }
+     
+     spin_lock_irqsave(&amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;lock, flags);
+     
+     /* Copy to DMA buffer */
+     memcpy(global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_buffer, src, size);
+     
+     /* Ensure write ordering */
+     wmb();
+     
+     /* DMA transfer initiated here */
+     /* In real implementation, would trigger GPU DMA engine */
+     
+     atomic64_inc(&amp;global_stats.transfers_to_gpu);
+     atomic64_add(size, &amp;global_stats.bytes_to_gpu);
+     
+     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;lock, flags);
+     
+     pr_debug(&quot;AI GPU: DMA to GPU: %zu bytes\n&quot;, size);
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ EXPORT_SYMBOL(ai_dma_to_gpu);
+ 
+ /*
+  * DMA transfer from GPU
+  */
+ int ai_dma_from_gpu(void *dest, size_t size, dma_addr_t gpu_addr)
+ {
+     unsigned long flags;
+     
+     if (!global_gpu_dev || !dest || size == 0) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Invalid DMA parameters\n&quot;);
+         return -EINVAL;
+     }
+     
+     if (size &gt; DMA_BUFFER_SIZE) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Transfer size exceeds buffer\n&quot;);
+         return -E2BIG;
+     }
+     
+     spin_lock_irqsave(&amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;lock, flags);
+     
+     /* Ensure read ordering */
+     rmb();
+     
+     /* Copy from DMA buffer */
+     memcpy(dest, global_gpu_dev-&gt;dma_buffer, size);
+     
+     atomic64_inc(&amp;global_stats.transfers_from_gpu);
+     atomic64_add(size, &amp;global_stats.bytes_from_gpu);
+     
+     spin_unlock_irqrestore(&amp;global_gpu_dev-&gt;lock, flags);
+     
+     pr_debug(&quot;AI GPU: DMA from GPU: %zu bytes\n&quot;, size);
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ EXPORT_SYMBOL(ai_dma_from_gpu);
+ 
+ /*
+  * Launch GPU compute kernel (simplified interface)
+  */
+ int ai_gpu_launch_kernel(void)
+ {
+     if (!global_gpu_dev) {
+         pr_err(&quot;AI GPU: Device not initialized\n&quot;);
+         return -ENODEV;
+     }
+     
+     /* In real implementation, would:
+      * 1. Setup GPU command buffer
+      * 2. Configure compute pipeline
+      * 3. Dispatch workgroups
+      * 4. Wait for completion
+      */
+     
+     atomic64_inc(&amp;global_stats.kernel_launches);
+     
+     pr_debug(&quot;AI GPU: Kernel launched\n&quot;);
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ EXPORT_SYMBOL(ai_gpu_launch_kernel);
+ 
+ /*
+  * /proc/ai_gpu statistics display
+  */
+ static int ai_gpu_proc_show(struct seq_file *m, void *v)
+ {
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;AI GPU Direct Access Status\n&quot;);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;============================\n&quot;);
+     
+     if (!global_gpu_dev) {
+         seq_printf(m, &quot;Status: Not initialized\n&quot;);
+         return 0;
+     }
+     
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;Status: Active\n&quot;);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;Device: %04x:%04x\n&quot;,
+                global_gpu_dev-&gt;pdev-&gt;vendor,
+                global_gpu_dev-&gt;pdev-&gt;device);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;DMA Buffer: %zu MB\n&quot;,
+                global_gpu_dev-&gt;buffer_size / 1024 / 1024);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;\nStatistics:\n&quot;);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;  Transfers to GPU: %lld\n&quot;,
+                atomic64_read(&amp;global_stats.transfers_to_gpu));
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;  Transfers from GPU: %lld\n&quot;,
+                atomic64_read(&amp;global_stats.transfers_from_gpu));
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;  Bytes to GPU: %lld MB\n&quot;,
+                atomic64_read(&amp;global_stats.bytes_to_gpu) / 1024 / 1024);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;  Bytes from GPU: %lld MB\n&quot;,
+                atomic64_read(&amp;global_stats.bytes_from_gpu) / 1024 / 1024);
+     seq_printf(m, &quot;  Kernel launches: %lld\n&quot;,
+                atomic64_read(&amp;global_stats.kernel_launches));
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ 
+ static int ai_gpu_proc_open(struct inode *inode, struct file *file)
+ {
+     return single_open(file, ai_gpu_proc_show, NULL);
+ }
+ 
+ static const struct proc_ops ai_gpu_proc_ops = {
+     .proc_open = ai_gpu_proc_open,
+     .proc_read = seq_read,
+     .proc_lseek = seq_lseek,
+     .proc_release = single_release,
+ };
+ 
+ /*
+  * Module initialization
+  */
+ static int __init ai_gpu_init(void)
+ {
+     int ret;
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;ğŸš€ AI GPU Direct Access: Initializing...\n&quot;);
+     
+     /* Initialize GPU device */
+     ret = ai_gpu_device_init();
+     if (ret &lt; 0) {
+         pr_warn(&quot;AI GPU: No GPU device available (continuing without GPU)\n&quot;);
+         /* Continue without GPU - module still loads */
+     }
+     
+     /* Create /proc entry */
+     proc_create(&quot;ai_gpu&quot;, 0444, NULL, &amp;ai_gpu_proc_ops);
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI GPU: Module loaded. Check /proc/ai_gpu for status\n&quot;);
+     
+     return 0;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Module cleanup
+  */
+ static void __exit ai_gpu_exit(void)
+ {
+     pr_info(&quot;AI GPU: Shutting down...\n&quot;);
+     
+     /* Remove /proc entry */
+     remove_proc_entry(&quot;ai_gpu&quot;, NULL);
+     
+     /* Cleanup GPU device */
+     ai_gpu_device_cleanup();
+     
+     pr_info(&quot;AI GPU: Stopped\n&quot;);
+ }
+ 
+ module_init(ai_gpu_init);
+ module_exit(ai_gpu_exit);
+

+ //! AI Scheduler - Rust Implementation
+ //! 
+ //! GPU-aware process scheduler for AI workloads
+ //! Requires Rust for Linux kernel support
+ 
+ #![no_std]
+ #![feature(allocator_api)]
+ 
+ // NOTE: This requires Rust for Linux kernel support
+ // For standalone use, this is a reference implementation
+ 
+ use core::sync::atomic::{AtomicU32, AtomicU64, Ordering};
+ 
+ /// GPU utilization (0-100%)
+ static GPU_UTILIZATION: AtomicU32 = AtomicU32::new(0);
+ 
+ /// GPU available flag
+ static GPU_AVAILABLE: AtomicU32 = AtomicU32::new(1);
+ 
+ /// AI task counter
+ static AI_TASK_COUNT: AtomicU64 = AtomicU64::new(0);
+ 
+ /// AI task priority
+ pub const AI_TASK_PRIORITY: i32 = 80;
+ pub const NORMAL_TASK_PRIORITY: i32 = 20;
+ 
+ /// Task classification
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq)]
+ pub enum TaskType {
+     AiInference,
+     Normal,
+ }
+ 
+ /// AI task information
+ #[repr(C)]
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy)]
+ pub struct AiTaskInfo {
+     pub pid: u32,
+     pub priority: i32,
+     pub gpu_time_jiffies: u64,
+     pub task_type: TaskType,
+ }
+ 
+ impl AiTaskInfo {
+     /// Create new AI task info
+     pub const fn new(pid: u32) -&gt; Self {
+         Self {
+             pid,
+             priority: AI_TASK_PRIORITY,
+             gpu_time_jiffies: 0,
+             task_type: TaskType::AiInference,
+         }
+     }
+     
+     /// Check if task should use GPU
+     pub const fn should_use_gpu(&amp;self) -&gt; bool {
+         matches!(self.task_type, TaskType::AiInference)
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Check if GPU is available for scheduling
+ #[inline]
+ pub fn is_gpu_available() -&gt; bool {
+     GPU_AVAILABLE.load(Ordering::Acquire) != 0
+ }
+ 
+ /// Get current GPU utilization
+ #[inline]
+ pub fn get_gpu_utilization() -&gt; u32 {
+     GPU_UTILIZATION.load(Ordering::Acquire)
+ }
+ 
+ /// Update GPU utilization
+ #[inline]
+ pub fn set_gpu_utilization(util: u32) {
+     let clamped = util.min(100);
+     GPU_UTILIZATION.store(clamped, Ordering::Release);
+     
+     // Update availability based on utilization
+     if clamped &lt; 50 {
+         GPU_AVAILABLE.store(1, Ordering::Release);
+     } else {
+         GPU_AVAILABLE.store(0, Ordering::Release);
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Register AI task
+ pub fn register_ai_task(pid: u32) -&gt; Result&lt;(), &amp;&#39;static str&gt; {
+     let count = AI_TASK_COUNT.fetch_add(1, Ordering::AcqRel);
+     
+     if count &gt;= 1024 {
+         AI_TASK_COUNT.fetch_sub(1, Ordering::AcqRel);
+         return Err(&quot;Maximum AI tasks reached&quot;);
+     }
+     
+     Ok(())
+ }
+ 
+ /// Unregister AI task
+ pub fn unregister_ai_task(pid: u32) {
+     AI_TASK_COUNT.fetch_sub(1, Ordering::AcqRel);
+ }
+ 
+ /// Get AI task count
+ #[inline]
+ pub fn get_ai_task_count() -&gt; u64 {
+     AI_TASK_COUNT.load(Ordering::Acquire)
+ }
+ 
+ /// Scheduling decision
+ pub fn should_schedule_on_gpu(task: &amp;AiTaskInfo) -&gt; bool {
+     task.should_use_gpu() &amp;&amp; is_gpu_available()
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use super::*;
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_gpu_utilization() {
+         set_gpu_utilization(30);
+         assert_eq!(get_gpu_utilization(), 30);
+         assert!(is_gpu_available());
+         
+         set_gpu_utilization(70);
+         assert_eq!(get_gpu_utilization(), 70);
+         assert!(!is_gpu_available());
+     }
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_task_registration() {
+         let count_before = get_ai_task_count();
+         register_ai_task(1234).unwrap();
+         assert_eq!(get_ai_task_count(), count_before + 1);
+         
+         unregister_ai_task(1234);
+         assert_eq!(get_ai_task_count(), count_before);
+     }
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_task_info() {
+         let task = AiTaskInfo::new(1234);
+         assert_eq!(task.pid, 1234);
+         assert_eq!(task.priority, AI_TASK_PRIORITY);
+         assert!(task.should_use_gpu());
+     }
+ }
+

+ //! Type-safe Rust bindings for GPU operations
+ 
+ #![no_std]
+ #![deny(warnings)]
+ #![deny(clippy::all)]
+ 
+ /// GPU device handle
+ #[repr(transparent)]

+ pub struct GpuDevice(pub u32);
+ 
+ impl GpuDevice {
+     /// Create new GPU device handle
+     pub const fn new(id: u32) -&gt; Self {
+         Self(id)
+     }
+     
+     /// Get device ID
+     pub const fn id(&amp;self) -&gt; u32 {
+         self.0
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// GPU memory address
+ #[repr(transparent)]
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq, PartialOrd, Ord)]
+ pub struct GpuMemoryAddress(pub u64);
+ 
+ impl GpuMemoryAddress {
+     /// Create new GPU memory address
+     pub const fn new(addr: u64) -&gt; Self {
+         Self(addr)
+     }
+     
+     /// Get raw address
+     pub const fn as_u64(&amp;self) -&gt; u64 {
+         self.0
+     }
+     
+     /// Check if address is aligned
+     pub const fn is_aligned(&amp;self, align: u64) -&gt; bool {
+         self.0 % align == 0
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// DMA transfer direction
+ #[repr(u32)]
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, PartialEq, Eq)]

+ impl GpuAllocFlags {

+     pub const PINNED: Self = Self(1 &lt;&lt; 0);
+     pub const ZERO_COPY: Self = Self(1 &lt;&lt; 1);
+     pub const WRITE_COMBINED: Self = Self(1 &lt;&lt; 2);
+     
+     /// Check if flags contain specific flag
+     pub const fn contains(&amp;self, other: Self) -&gt; bool {
+         (self.0 &amp; other.0) == other.0

+     /// Combine flags

+         Self(self.0 | other.0)
+     }
+ }

+ //! Codex AI-Native OS Integration
+ //! 
+ //! User-space library for interacting with AI kernel extensions
+ 
+ use std::fs;
+ use std::io::{self, Read};
+ use std::path::Path;
+ 
+ /// AI kernel module statistics
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Default)]
+ pub struct KernelModuleStats {
+     pub scheduler: Option&lt;SchedulerStats&gt;,
+     pub memory: Option&lt;MemoryStats&gt;,
+     pub gpu: Option&lt;GpuStats&gt;,
+ }
+ 
+ /// AI Scheduler statistics
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone)]
+ pub struct SchedulerStats {
+     pub gpu_utilization_percent: u32,
+     pub gpu_available: bool,
+     pub ai_task_count: u32,
+ }
+ 
+ /// AI Memory statistics
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone)]
+ pub struct MemoryStats {
+     pub total_pool_mb: u64,
+     pub block_size_kb: u64,
+     pub total_blocks: u32,
+     pub allocated_bytes: u64,
+ }
+ 
+ /// GPU statistics
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone)]
+ pub struct GpuStats {
+     pub device_vendor: u16,
+     pub device_id: u16,
+     pub dma_buffer_mb: u64,
+     pub transfers_to_gpu: u64,
+     pub transfers_from_gpu: u64,
+     pub bytes_to_gpu_mb: u64,
+     pub bytes_from_gpu_mb: u64,
+     pub kernel_launches: u64,
+ }
+ 
+ impl KernelModuleStats {
+     /// Read statistics from kernel modules via /proc
+     pub fn read() -&gt; io::Result&lt;Self&gt; {
+         Ok(Self {
+             scheduler: Self::read_scheduler().ok(),
+             memory: Self::read_memory().ok(),
+             gpu: Self::read_gpu().ok(),
+         })
+     }
+     
+     fn read_scheduler() -&gt; io::Result&lt;SchedulerStats&gt; {
+         let content = fs::read_to_string(&quot;/proc/ai_scheduler&quot;)?;
+         
+         // Parse simple format
+         let mut stats = SchedulerStats {
+             gpu_utilization_percent: 0,
+             gpu_available: false,
+             ai_task_count: 0,
+         };
+         
+         for line in content.lines() {
+             if line.contains(&quot;GPU Utilization:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.gpu_utilization_percent = val as u32;
+                 }
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;GPU Available:&quot;) {
+                 stats.gpu_available = line.contains(&quot;Yes&quot;);
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;AI Tasks:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.ai_task_count = val as u32;
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         Ok(stats)
+     }
+     
+     fn read_memory() -&gt; io::Result&lt;MemoryStats&gt; {
+         let content = fs::read_to_string(&quot;/proc/ai_memory&quot;)?;
+         
+         let mut stats = MemoryStats {
+             total_pool_mb: 0,
+             block_size_kb: 0,
+             total_blocks: 0,
+             allocated_bytes: 0,
+         };
+         
+         for line in content.lines() {
+             if line.contains(&quot;Total Pool Size:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.total_pool_mb = val;
+                 }
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;Block Size:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.block_size_kb = val;
+                 }
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;Total Blocks:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.total_blocks = val as u32;
+                 }
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;Allocated:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.allocated_bytes = val;
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         Ok(stats)
+     }
+     
+     fn read_gpu() -&gt; io::Result&lt;GpuStats&gt; {
+         let content = fs::read_to_string(&quot;/proc/ai_gpu&quot;)?;
+         
+         let mut stats = GpuStats {
+             device_vendor: 0,
+             device_id: 0,
+             dma_buffer_mb: 0,
+             transfers_to_gpu: 0,
+             transfers_from_gpu: 0,
+             bytes_to_gpu_mb: 0,
+             bytes_from_gpu_mb: 0,
+             kernel_launches: 0,
+         };
+         
+         for line in content.lines() {
+             if line.contains(&quot;DMA Buffer:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.dma_buffer_mb = val;
+                 }
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;Transfers to GPU:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.transfers_to_gpu = val;
+                 }
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;Transfers from GPU:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.transfers_from_gpu = val;
+                 }
+             } else if line.contains(&quot;Kernel launches:&quot;) {
+                 if let Some(val) = Self::extract_number(line) {
+                     stats.kernel_launches = val;
+                 }
+             }
+         }
+         
+         Ok(stats)
+     }
+     
+     fn extract_number(line: &amp;str) -&gt; Option&lt;u64&gt; {
+         line.split_whitespace()
+             .find_map(|s| s.parse::&lt;u64&gt;().ok())
+     }
+     
+     /// Check if any kernel module is loaded
+     pub fn is_available(&amp;self) -&gt; bool {
+         self.scheduler.is_some() || self.memory.is_some() || self.gpu.is_some()
+     }
+     
+     /// Print formatted statistics
+     pub fn print(&amp;self) {
+         println!(&quot;ğŸ”§ AI Kernel Module Statistics\n&quot;);
+         
+         if let Some(ref sched) = self.scheduler {
+             println!(&quot;ğŸ“Š AI Scheduler:&quot;);
+             println!(&quot;  GPU Utilization: {}%&quot;, sched.gpu_utilization_percent);
+             println!(&quot;  GPU Available: {}&quot;, sched.gpu_available);
+             println!(&quot;  AI Tasks: {}&quot;, sched.ai_task_count);
+             println!();
+         }
+         
+         if let Some(ref mem) = self.memory {
+             println!(&quot;ğŸ’¾ AI Memory:&quot;);
+             println!(&quot;  Total Pool: {} MB&quot;, mem.total_pool_mb);
+             println!(&quot;  Block Size: {} KB&quot;, mem.block_size_kb);
+             println!(&quot;  Total Blocks: {}&quot;, mem.total_blocks);
+             println!(&quot;  Allocated: {} MB&quot;, mem.allocated_bytes / 1024 / 1024);
+             println!();
+         }
+         
+         if let Some(ref gpu) = self.gpu {
+             println!(&quot;âš¡ GPU Direct:&quot;);
+             println!(&quot;  Device: {:04x}:{:04x}&quot;, gpu.device_vendor, gpu.device_id);
+             println!(&quot;  DMA Buffer: {} MB&quot;, gpu.dma_buffer_mb);
+             println!(&quot;  Transfers to GPU: {}&quot;, gpu.transfers_to_gpu);
+             println!(&quot;  Transfers from GPU: {}&quot;, gpu.transfers_from_gpu);
+             println!(&quot;  Kernel Launches: {}&quot;, gpu.kernel_launches);
+             println!();
+         }
+         
+         if !self.is_available() {
+             println!(&quot;âš ï¸  No AI kernel modules loaded&quot;);
+             println!(&quot;   Load with: sudo insmod ai_scheduler.ko&quot;);
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use super::*;
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_extract_number() {
+         assert_eq!(
+             KernelModuleStats::extract_number(&quot;GPU Utilization: 75%&quot;),
+             Some(75)
+         );
+         assert_eq!(
+             KernelModuleStats::extract_number(&quot;Total Pool Size: 256 MB&quot;),
+             Some(256)
+         );
+     }
+ }
+

+ //! Integration tests for ai-scheduler-rs
+ //! These tests run with std support
+ 
+ use ai_scheduler_rs::*;
+ 
+ #[test]
+ fn test_gpu_utilization() {
+     set_gpu_utilization(30);
+     assert_eq!(get_gpu_utilization(), 30);
+     assert!(is_gpu_available());
+     
+     set_gpu_utilization(70);
+     assert_eq!(get_gpu_utilization(), 70);
+     assert!(!is_gpu_available());
+     
+     // Test clamping
+     set_gpu_utilization(150);
+     assert_eq!(get_gpu_utilization(), 100);
+ }
+ 
+ #[test]
+ fn test_task_registration() {
+     let count_before = get_ai_task_count();
+     register_ai_task(1234).unwrap();
+     assert_eq!(get_ai_task_count(), count_before + 1);
+     
+     unregister_ai_task(1234);
+     assert_eq!(get_ai_task_count(), count_before);
+ }
+ 
+ #[test]
+ fn test_task_info() {
+     let task = AiTaskInfo::new(1234);
+     assert_eq!(task.pid, 1234);
+     assert_eq!(task.priority, AI_TASK_PRIORITY);
+     assert!(task.should_use_gpu());
+ }
+ 
+ #[test]
+ fn test_scheduling_decision() {
+     let task = AiTaskInfo::new(1234);
+     
+     // GPU available
+     set_gpu_utilization(30);
+     assert!(should_schedule_on_gpu(&amp;task));
+     
+     // GPU busy
+     set_gpu_utilization(90);
+     assert!(!should_schedule_on_gpu(&amp;task));
+ }
+

+ /*
+  * AI Filter Driver for Windows
+  * WDM/KMDF Filter Driver
+  * 
+  * Features:
+  * - GPU-aware thread scheduling
+  * - AI task detection
+  * - Non-paged memory pool
+  * - DirectX/CUDA integration
+  */
+ 
+ #include &lt;ntddk.h&gt;
+ #include &lt;wdf.h&gt;
+ 
+ #define AI_DRIVER_TAG &#39;iAcD&#39;  // &#39;DcAi&#39; reversed
+ #define AI_MEMORY_POOL_SIZE (256 * 1024 * 1024)  // 256MB
+ 
+ /* Driver globals */
+ typedef struct _AI_DRIVER_GLOBALS {
+     WDFDRIVER Driver;
+     PVOID MemoryPool;
+     SIZE_T PoolSize;
+     KSPIN_LOCK PoolLock;
+     LONG AiTaskCount;
+     LONG GpuUtilization;
+ } AI_DRIVER_GLOBALS, *PAI_DRIVER_GLOBALS;
+ 
+ static AI_DRIVER_GLOBALS g_Globals = { 0 };
+ 
+ /* Forward declarations */
+ DRIVER_INITIALIZE DriverEntry;
+ EVT_WDF_DRIVER_DEVICE_ADD AiDriverDeviceAdd;
+ EVT_WDF_OBJECT_CONTEXT_CLEANUP AiDriverCleanup;
+ 
+ /*
+  * Check if process is AI-related
+  */
+ _Use_decl_annotations_
+ BOOLEAN IsAiProcess(PEPROCESS Process)
+ {
+     PUNICODE_STRING processName;
+     
+     if (!Process) {
+         return FALSE;
+     }
+     
+     processName = (PUNICODE_STRING)PsGetProcessImageFileName(Process);
+     if (!processName) {
+         return FALSE;
+     }
+     
+     /* Check for AI-related process names */
+     if (wcsstr(processName-&gt;Buffer, L&quot;python&quot;) ||
+         wcsstr(processName-&gt;Buffer, L&quot;codex&quot;) ||
+         wcsstr(processName-&gt;Buffer, L&quot;ai&quot;) ||
+         wcsstr(processName-&gt;Buffer, L&quot;ml&quot;)) {
+         return TRUE;
+     }
+     
+     return FALSE;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Boost thread priority for AI tasks
+  */
+ _Use_decl_annotations_
+ NTSTATUS BoostAiThreadPriority(PETHREAD Thread)
+ {
+     KPRIORITY newPriority = HIGH_PRIORITY;
+     
+     if (!Thread) {
+         return STATUS_INVALID_PARAMETER;
+     }
+     
+     /* Set high priority for AI inference threads */
+     KeSetBasePriorityThread(Thread, newPriority);
+     
+     KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Boosted thread priority to %d\n&quot;, newPriority));
+     
+     return STATUS_SUCCESS;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Allocate non-paged memory for AI workloads
+  */
+ _Use_decl_annotations_
+ PVOID AiAllocateNonPagedMemory(SIZE_T Size)
+ {
+     PVOID buffer;
+     
+     if (Size == 0 || Size &gt; AI_MEMORY_POOL_SIZE) {
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Invalid allocation size: %zu\n&quot;, Size));
+         return NULL;
+     }
+     
+     buffer = ExAllocatePoolWithTag(
+         NonPagedPool,
+         Size,
+         AI_DRIVER_TAG
+     );
+     
+     if (buffer) {
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Allocated %zu bytes of non-paged memory\n&quot;, Size));
+     } else {
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Failed to allocate memory\n&quot;));
+     }
+     
+     return buffer;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Free non-paged memory
+  */
+ _Use_decl_annotations_
+ VOID AiFreeNonPagedMemory(PVOID Buffer)
+ {
+     if (Buffer) {
+         ExFreePoolWithTag(Buffer, AI_DRIVER_TAG);
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Freed memory\n&quot;));
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Device add callback
+  */
+ _Use_decl_annotations_
+ NTSTATUS AiDriverDeviceAdd(
+     WDFDRIVER Driver,
+     PWDFDEVICE_INIT DeviceInit
+ )
+ {
+     NTSTATUS status;
+     WDFDEVICE device;
+     WDF_OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES attributes;
+     
+     UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER(Driver);
+     
+     WDF_OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES_INIT(&amp;attributes);
+     attributes.EvtCleanupCallback = AiDriverCleanup;
+     
+     status = WdfDeviceCreate(&amp;DeviceInit, &amp;attributes, &amp;device);
+     if (!NT_SUCCESS(status)) {
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: WdfDeviceCreate failed: 0x%08X\n&quot;, status));
+         return status;
+     }
+     
+     KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Device added successfully\n&quot;));
+     
+     return STATUS_SUCCESS;
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Cleanup callback
+  */
+ _Use_decl_annotations_
+ VOID AiDriverCleanup(WDFOBJECT Object)
+ {
+     UNREFERENCED_PARAMETER(Object);
+     
+     /* Free memory pool */
+     if (g_Globals.MemoryPool) {
+         AiFreeNonPagedMemory(g_Globals.MemoryPool);
+         g_Globals.MemoryPool = NULL;
+     }
+     
+     KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Cleanup completed\n&quot;));
+ }
+ 
+ /*
+  * Driver Entry Point
+  */
+ _Use_decl_annotations_
+ NTSTATUS DriverEntry(
+     PDRIVER_OBJECT DriverObject,
+     PUNICODE_STRING RegistryPath
+ )
+ {
+     NTSTATUS status;
+     WDF_DRIVER_CONFIG config;
+     
+     KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Initializing...\n&quot;));
+     
+     /* Initialize globals */
+     RtlZeroMemory(&amp;g_Globals, sizeof(AI_DRIVER_GLOBALS));
+     KeInitializeSpinLock(&amp;g_Globals.PoolLock);
+     g_Globals.AiTaskCount = 0;
+     g_Globals.GpuUtilization = 0;
+     
+     /* Allocate memory pool */
+     g_Globals.MemoryPool = AiAllocateNonPagedMemory(AI_MEMORY_POOL_SIZE);
+     if (!g_Globals.MemoryPool) {
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Failed to allocate memory pool\n&quot;));
+         /* Continue without pool - not fatal */
+     } else {
+         g_Globals.PoolSize = AI_MEMORY_POOL_SIZE;
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Memory pool allocated: %zu MB\n&quot;,
+                  AI_MEMORY_POOL_SIZE / 1024 / 1024));
+     }
+     
+     /* Initialize WDF */
+     WDF_DRIVER_CONFIG_INIT(&amp;config, AiDriverDeviceAdd);
+     
+     status = WdfDriverCreate(
+         DriverObject,
+         RegistryPath,
+         WDF_NO_OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES,
+         &amp;config,
+         &amp;g_Globals.Driver
+     );
+     
+     if (!NT_SUCCESS(status)) {
+         KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: WdfDriverCreate failed: 0x%08X\n&quot;, status));
+         if (g_Globals.MemoryPool) {
+             AiFreeNonPagedMemory(g_Globals.MemoryPool);
+         }
+         return status;
+     }
+     
+     KdPrint((&quot;AI Driver: Initialized successfully\n&quot;));
+     
+     return STATUS_SUCCESS;
+ }
+

+ //! Windows AI Driver API
+ //! 
+ //! Type-safe Rust bindings for Windows AI kernel driver
+ 
+ use std::ptr;
+ use windows::core::Error as WindowsError;
+ use windows::Win32::Foundation::{HANDLE, INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE};
+ use windows::Win32::Storage::FileSystem::{CreateFileW, FILE_FLAGS_AND_ATTRIBUTES, FILE_SHARE_MODE, OPEN_EXISTING};
+ use windows::Win32::System::IO::DeviceIoControl;
+ 
+ /// AI Driver device path
+ const AI_DRIVER_DEVICE: &amp;str = &quot;\\\\.\\AIDriver&quot;;
+ 
+ /// IOCTL codes
+ const IOCTL_AI_GET_STATS: u32 = 0x222004;  // CTL_CODE(FILE_DEVICE_UNKNOWN, 0x801, METHOD_BUFFERED, FILE_ANY_ACCESS)
+ const IOCTL_AI_SET_GPU_UTIL: u32 = 0x222008;
+ const IOCTL_AI_BOOST_PRIORITY: u32 = 0x22200C;
+ 
+ /// AI Driver handle
+ #[derive(Debug)]
+ pub struct AiDriverHandle {
+     handle: HANDLE,
+ }
+ 
+ impl AiDriverHandle {
+     /// Open AI driver device
+     pub fn open() -&gt; Result&lt;Self, WindowsError&gt; {
+         let device_path: Vec&lt;u16&gt; = AI_DRIVER_DEVICE
+             .encode_utf16()
+             .chain(std::iter::once(0))
+             .collect();
+         
+         let handle = unsafe {
+             CreateFileW(
+                 windows::core::PCWSTR::from_raw(device_path.as_ptr()),
+                 0x80000000 | 0x40000000,  // GENERIC_READ | GENERIC_WRITE
+                 FILE_SHARE_MODE(0),
+                 None,
+                 OPEN_EXISTING,
+                 FILE_FLAGS_AND_ATTRIBUTES(0),
+                 HANDLE::default(),
+             )?
+         };
+         
+         if handle == INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE {
+             return Err(WindowsError::from_win32());
+         }
+         
+         Ok(Self { handle })
+     }
+     
+     /// Get driver statistics
+     pub fn get_stats(&amp;self) -&gt; Result&lt;DriverStats, WindowsError&gt; {
+         let mut stats = DriverStats::default();
+         let mut bytes_returned = 0u32;
+         
+         unsafe {
+             DeviceIoControl(
+                 self.handle,
+                 IOCTL_AI_GET_STATS,
+                 None,
+                 0,
+                 Some(&amp;mut stats as *mut _ as *mut _),
+                 std::mem::size_of::&lt;DriverStats&gt;() as u32,
+                 Some(&amp;mut bytes_returned),
+                 None,
+             )?;
+         }
+         
+         Ok(stats)
+     }
+     
+     /// Set GPU utilization
+     pub fn set_gpu_utilization(&amp;self, util: u32) -&gt; Result&lt;(), WindowsError&gt; {
+         let util_clamped = util.min(100);
+         let mut bytes_returned = 0u32;
+         
+         unsafe {
+             DeviceIoControl(
+                 self.handle,
+                 IOCTL_AI_SET_GPU_UTIL,
+                 Some(&amp;util_clamped as *const _ as *const _),
+                 std::mem::size_of::&lt;u32&gt;() as u32,
+                 None,
+                 0,
+                 Some(&amp;mut bytes_returned),
+                 None,
+             )?;
+         }
+         
+         Ok(())
+     }
+     
+     /// Boost thread priority for AI task
+     pub fn boost_priority(&amp;self, thread_id: u32) -&gt; Result&lt;(), WindowsError&gt; {
+         let mut bytes_returned = 0u32;
+         
+         unsafe {
+             DeviceIoControl(
+                 self.handle,
+                 IOCTL_AI_BOOST_PRIORITY,
+                 Some(&amp;thread_id as *const _ as *const _),
+                 std::mem::size_of::&lt;u32&gt;() as u32,
+                 None,
+                 0,
+                 Some(&amp;mut bytes_returned),
+                 None,
+             )?;
+         }
+         
+         Ok(())
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ impl Drop for AiDriverHandle {
+     fn drop(&amp;mut self) {
+         unsafe {
+             let _ = windows::Win32::Foundation::CloseHandle(self.handle);
+         }
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ /// Driver statistics
+ #[repr(C)]
+ #[derive(Debug, Clone, Copy, Default)]
+ pub struct DriverStats {
+     pub ai_task_count: u32,
+     pub gpu_utilization: u32,
+     pub memory_pool_size: u64,
+     pub memory_allocated: u64,
+     pub priority_boosts: u64,
+ }
+ 
+ impl DriverStats {
+     /// Print formatted statistics
+     pub fn print(&amp;self) {
+         println!(&quot;ğŸ“Š Windows AI Driver Statistics&quot;);
+         println!(&quot;================================&quot;);
+         println!(&quot;AI Tasks: {}&quot;, self.ai_task_count);
+         println!(&quot;GPU Utilization: {}%&quot;, self.gpu_utilization);
+         println!(&quot;Memory Pool: {} MB&quot;, self.memory_pool_size / 1024 / 1024);
+         println!(&quot;Allocated: {} MB&quot;, self.memory_allocated / 1024 / 1024);
+         println!(&quot;Priority Boosts: {}&quot;, self.priority_boosts);
+     }
+ }
+ 
+ #[cfg(test)]
+ mod tests {
+     use super::*;
+ 
+     #[test]
+     fn test_driver_stats_default() {
+         let stats = DriverStats::default();
+         assert_eq!(stats.ai_task_count, 0);
+         assert_eq!(stats.gpu_utilization, 0);
+     }
+     
+     #[test]
+     fn test_ioctl_codes() {
+         assert_eq!(IOCTL_AI_GET_STATS, 0x222004);
+         assert_eq!(IOCTL_AI_SET_GPU_UTIL, 0x222008);
+         assert_eq!(IOCTL_AI_BOOST_PRIORITY, 0x22200C);
+     }
+ }
+

+ #!/usr/bin/env python3
+ &quot;&quot;&quot;
+ AI Kernel Module Stress Test
+ Runs continuous load for 24 hours
+ &quot;&quot;&quot;
+ 
+ import subprocess
+ import time
+ import sys
+ import os
+ from datetime import datetime, timedelta
+ from collections import defaultdict
+ 
+ class StressTest:
+     def __init__(self, duration_hours=24):
+         self.duration = duration_hours * 3600  # Convert to seconds
+         self.start_time = time.time()
+         self.stats = defaultdict(int)
+         
+     def log(self, message):
+         timestamp = datetime.now().strftime(&#39;%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S&#39;)
+         print(f&quot;[{timestamp}] {message}&quot;)
+         
+     def check_modules_loaded(self):
+         &quot;&quot;&quot;Check if AI kernel modules are loaded&quot;&quot;&quot;
+         result = subprocess.run(
+             [&#39;lsmod&#39;],
+             capture_output=True,
+             text=True
+         )
+         
+         modules = [&#39;ai_scheduler&#39;, &#39;ai_mem&#39;, &#39;ai_gpu&#39;]
+         loaded = []
+         
+         for module in modules:
+             if module in result.stdout:
+                 loaded.append(module)
+         
+         return loaded
+     
+     def run_inference_batch(self):
+         &quot;&quot;&quot;Simulate AI inference batch&quot;&quot;&quot;
+         # This would call actual AI models
+         # For now, simulate with sleep
+         time.sleep(0.01)  # 10ms inference
+         self.stats[&#39;inferences&#39;] += 1
+     
+     def check_memory_usage(self):
+         &quot;&quot;&quot;Check /proc/ai_memory status&quot;&quot;&quot;
+         try:
+             with open(&#39;/proc/ai_memory&#39;, &#39;r&#39;) as f:
+                 content = f.read()
+                 # Parse allocated bytes
+                 for line in content.split(&#39;\n&#39;):
+                     if &#39;Allocated:&#39; in line:
+                         parts = line.split()
+                         if len(parts) &gt;= 2:
+                             allocated = int(parts[1])
+                             self.stats[&#39;peak_memory&#39;] = max(
+                                 self.stats[&#39;peak_memory&#39;],
+                                 allocated
+                             )
+         except FileNotFoundError:
+             pass
+     
+     def check_gpu_stats(self):
+         &quot;&quot;&quot;Check /proc/ai_gpu status&quot;&quot;&quot;
+         try:
+             with open(&#39;/proc/ai_gpu&#39;, &#39;r&#39;) as f:
+                 content = f.read()
+                 self.stats[&#39;gpu_checks&#39;] += 1
+         except FileNotFoundError:
+             pass
+     
+     def run(self):
+         &quot;&quot;&quot;Run stress test&quot;&quot;&quot;
+         self.log(f&quot;ğŸš€ Starting {self.duration / 3600:.1f}h stress test&quot;)
+         
+         # Check modules
+         loaded = self.check_modules_loaded()
+         if not loaded:
+             self.log(&quot;âŒ No AI kernel modules loaded&quot;)
+             self.log(&quot;   Load with: sudo insmod ai_scheduler.ko&quot;)
+             return 1
+         
+         self.log(f&quot;âœ… Loaded modules: {&#39;, &#39;.join(loaded)}&quot;)
+         
+         iteration = 0
+         last_report = time.time()
+         
+         try:
+             while (time.time() - self.start_time) &lt; self.duration:
+                 iteration += 1
+                 
+                 # Run inference batch
+                 self.run_inference_batch()
+                 
+                 # Check memory every 100 iterations
+                 if iteration % 100 == 0:
+                     self.check_memory_usage()
+                     self.check_gpu_stats()
+                 
+                 # Report every 60 seconds
+                 if time.time() - last_report &gt;= 60:
+                     elapsed = time.time() - self.start_time
+                     remaining = self.duration - elapsed
+                     
+                     self.log(f&quot;ğŸ“Š Progress: {elapsed / 3600:.2f}h / {self.duration / 3600:.1f}h&quot;)
+                     self.log(f&quot;   Inferences: {self.stats[&#39;inferences&#39;]}&quot;)
+                     self.log(f&quot;   Peak Memory: {self.stats[&#39;peak_memory&#39;] / 1024 / 1024:.1f} MB&quot;)
+                     self.log(f&quot;   Remaining: {remaining / 3600:.2f}h&quot;)
+                     
+                     last_report = time.time()
+                 
+                 # Small sleep to prevent 100% CPU
+                 time.sleep(0.001)
+                 
+         except KeyboardInterrupt:
+             self.log(&quot;\nâš ï¸  Test interrupted by user&quot;)
+         
+         # Final report
+         total_time = time.time() - self.start_time
+         self.log(f&quot;\nğŸ‰ Stress test completed!&quot;)

+ # Codex Architecture
+ 
+ Complete architecture documentation for the Codex AI-Native OS project.
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“ High-Level Architecture
+ 
+ ![Architecture Diagram](docs/architecture/codex-architecture.svg)
+ 
+ ## ğŸ—ï¸ System Layers
+ 
+ ### Layer 1: Hardware
+ 
+ - **CPU**: x86_64/ARM64, 16+ cores
+ - **GPU**: NVIDIA (CUDA 12), AMD (ROCm), Intel (oneAPI)
+ - **Memory**: DDR4/DDR5, 64GB+, NUMA-aware
+ - **Storage**: NVMe SSD, PCIe 4.0
+ 
+ ### Layer 2: Kernel Space
+ 
+ #### Linux Kernel Modules
+ 
+ **AI Scheduler** (&#96;ai_scheduler.ko&#96;):
+ - GPU-aware process scheduling
+ - Priority boost for AI tasks
+ - Real-time latency optimization
+ - &#96;/proc/ai_scheduler&#96; interface
+ 
+ **AI Memory** (&#96;ai_mem.ko&#96;):
+ - 256MB pinned memory pool
+ - 4KB block allocation
+ - Zero-copy GPU transfers
+ - &#96;/proc/ai_memory&#96; statistics
+ 
+ **AI GPU** (&#96;ai_gpu.ko&#96;):
+ - Direct GPU DMA control
+ - PCI device management
+ - Kernel-space GPU launches
+ - &#96;/proc/ai_gpu&#96; monitoring
+ 
+ #### Windows Kernel Driver
+ 
+ **AI Driver** (&#96;ai_driver.sys&#96;):
+ - WDM/KMDF filter driver
+ - Thread priority boost
+ - Non-paged memory pool
+ - ETW performance tracing
+ 
+ #### eBPF Tracing
+ 
+ - GPU utilization monitoring
+ - Inference latency histogram
+ - Real-time performance metrics
+ - BCC/bpftrace integration
+ 
+ ### Layer 3: User Space
+ 
+ #### Core (Rust)
+ 
+ **Codex Core** (&#96;codex-rs/core/&#96;):
+ - AI assistant engine
+ - Sub-agent orchestration
+ - Deep research capabilities
+ - MCP server integration
+ 
+ **CLI** (&#96;codex-rs/cli/&#96;):
+ - Command-line interface
+ - TUI (Terminal UI)
+ - Configuration management
+ - Session handling
+ 
+ #### Kernel Integration
+ 
+ **Type-safe Rust APIs**:
+ - &#96;ai-scheduler-rs&#96;: Scheduler logic
+ - &#96;gpu-bindings&#96;: GPU operations
+ - &#96;codex-ai-kernel-integration&#96;: /proc parser
+ - &#96;codex-win-api&#96;: Windows driver API
+ 
+ #### Repository Visualizer
+ 
+ **Backend** (Rust + axum):
+ - REST API (13 endpoints)
+ - WebSocket real-time updates
+ - Git history analysis
+ - Collaboration features
+ 
+ **Frontend** (React + Three.js):
+ - 3D/4D visualization
+ - GPU-accelerated rendering
+ - Timeline slider
+ - Search/Filter/Bookmarks
+ 
+ **Desktop** (Electron):
+ - System tray integration
+ - Auto-updater
+ - Native notifications
+ - Cross-platform (Windows/Mac/Linux)
+ 
+ ## ğŸ”„ Data Flow
+ 
+ ### AI Inference Request
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Application
+   â†“ (syscall or library call)
+ User Space API
+   â†“ (/proc write or ioctl)
+ Kernel Module
+   â†“ (GPU scheduling decision)
+ AI Scheduler
+   â†“ (pinned memory allocation)
+ AI Memory
+   â†“ (DMA transfer)
+ AI GPU
+   â†“ (PCIe)
+ GPU Hardware
+   â†“ (computation)
+ Result
+   â†“ (DMA back)
+ Application
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Repository Visualization
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ Git Repository
+   â†“ (git2 crate)
+ Backend Analyzer
+   â†“ (REST API)
+ Frontend React
+   â†“ (Three.js)
+ GPU Rendering
+   â†“ (Canvas)
+ User Display
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Real-time Updates
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ .git/ Directory Change
+   â†“ (notify crate)
+ File Watcher
+   â†“ (WebSocket)
+ Frontend
+   â†“ (React state update)
+ 3D Scene Update
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“Š Performance Optimization
+ 
+ ### Kernel Optimizations
+ 
+ 1. **Zero-copy Transfers**: Pinned memory eliminates CPUâ†”GPU copies
+ 2. **GPU-aware Scheduling**: Scheduler knows GPU availability
+ 3. **Direct DMA**: Kernel bypasses user-space for GPU access
+ 4. **NUMA Awareness**: Memory allocated close to GPU
+ 
+ ### Frontend Optimizations
+ 
+ 1. **InstancedMesh**: 99.9% reduction in draw calls
+ 2. **LOD System**: Detail based on camera distance
+ 3. **Web Workers**: Background computation
+ 4. **Data Streaming**: Pagination and SSE
+ 
+ ## ğŸ”’ Security Architecture
+ 
+ ### Kernel Security
+ 
+ - **Capability checks**: &#96;CAP_SYS_ADMIN&#96; required
+ - **Input validation**: All user inputs validated
+ - **Memory safety**: Bounds checking, NULL checks
+ - **SELinux/AppArmor**: Security module integration
+ 
+ ### User Space Security
+ 
+ - **Type safety**: Rust prevents memory errors
+ - **No unsafe**: Minimal unsafe code, all documented
+ - **Sandboxing**: Electron app sandboxed
+ - **HTTPS**: All network communication encrypted
+ 
+ ## ğŸ§© Component Interactions
+ 
+ ### Codex Core â†” Kernel Modules
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
+ // User space reads kernel stats via /proc
+ let stats = KernelModuleStats::read()?;
+ println!(&quot;GPU Utilization: {}%&quot;, stats.scheduler.unwrap().gpu_utilization_percent);
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Frontend â†” Backend
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ // Frontend fetches data via REST API
+ const commits = await axios.get(&#39;/api/commits&#39;);
+ 
+ // Real-time updates via WebSocket
+ const ws = new WebSocket(&#39;ws://localhost:3030/api/realtime&#39;);
+ ws.onmessage = (event) =&gt; {
+   const update = JSON.parse(event.data);
+   // Update 3D scene
+ };
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ### Desktop â†” Kernel
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;typescript
+ // Electron app monitors kernel
+ window.electronAPI.onOpenRepo((path) =&gt; {
+   // Start monitoring repository
+   // Kernel modules optimize in background
+ });
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## ğŸ“ˆ Scalability
+ 
+ ### Vertical Scaling
+ 
+ - **Multi-GPU**: Support for multiple GPUs
+ - **NUMA**: Optimal memory placement
+ - **Thread pool**: Parallel processing
+ 
+ ### Horizontal Scaling
+ 
+ - **Distributed**: Future Redis/PostgreSQL support
+ - **Load balancing**: Multiple backend instances
+ - **Caching**: Result caching for repeated queries
+ 
+ ## ğŸ”® Future Architecture
+ 
+ Planned enhancements:
+ 
+ 1. **Distributed Kernel**: Multi-node GPU scheduling
+ 2. **Cloud Integration**: Kubernetes GPU operator
+ 3. **Mobile**: React Native visualizer
+ 4. **WebAssembly**: Client-side computation
+ 5. **gRPC**: High-performance RPC
+

(æ–°è¦ã€250è¡Œ)\n\n**packages/webhook/src/manager.ts**:\n&#96;&#96;&#96;typescript\nimport * as crypto from &#39;crypto&#39;\nimport type { WebhookConfig, WebhookPayload, WebhookEvent } from &#39;@prism/types&#39;\n\nexport class WebhookManager {\n  private webhooks: Map&lt;string, WebhookConfig&gt; = new Map()\n  \n  register(config: WebhookConfig): void {\n = {\n      ...payload,\n      signature: webhook.secret ? this.generateSignature(payload, webhook.secret) : undefined\n    }\n    \n    try {\n      const response = await fetch(webhook.url, {\n
