```diff
- #### **Multi-Agent Orchestration System**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // Automatic task complexity analysis
- pub struct TaskAnalyzer {
-     complexity_threshold: f64,
- }
- 
- impl TaskAnalyzer {
-     pub fn analyze(&amp;self, user_input: &amp;str) -&gt; TaskAnalysis {
-         let complexity_score = self.calculate_complexity(user_input);
-         // 5-factor scoring: words, sentences, actions, domains, conjunctions
-         // Score range: 0.0 (simple) to 1.0 (extremely complex)
-         
-         if complexity_score &gt; 0.7 {
-             // Trigger autonomous orchestration
-             self.recommend_agents(user_input)
-         }
-     }
- }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Key Components**:
- - **TaskAnalyzer** (&#96;task_analyzer.rs&#96;): 5-dimension complexity scoring with keyword detection
- - **AutoOrchestrator** (&#96;auto_orchestrator.rs&#96;): Dynamic agent selection and parallel execution
- - **CollaborationStore** (&#96;collaboration_store.rs&#96;): DashMap-based shared memory (Arc&lt;DashMap&gt;)
- - **AutonomousDispatcher** (&#96;autonomous_dispatcher.rs&#96;): Keyword-based agent triggering with priority queues
- 
- #### **Conflict-Free File Editing**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // FileEditTracker prevents race conditions
- pub struct FileEditTracker {
-     file_edits: DashMap&lt;PathBuf, Arc&lt;RwLock&lt;Vec&lt;EditOperation&gt;&gt;&gt;&gt;,
-     strategy: MergeStrategy,
- }
- 
- pub enum MergeStrategy {
-     Sequential,      // Queue edits, execute one-by-one
-     ThreeWayMerge,   // Intelligent merge (git-style)
-     LastWriteWins,   // Override conflicts (fast but may cause data loss)
- }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Features**:
- - **DashMap**: Fine-grained locking concurrent HashMap for high-performance access
- - **Edit Tokens**: UUID-based permission system with agent name tracking
- - **Merge Strategies**: Configurable conflict resolution policies
- - **Audit Trail**: Complete edit history with timestamps and contributors
- 
- #### **Natural Language Command Interpretation**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // AgentInterpreter translates natural language to agent actions
- pub struct AgentInterpreter {
-     patterns: Vec&lt;Pattern&gt;,  // Precompiled regex patterns
- }
- 
- // Example: &quot;Review my code for security vulnerabilities&quot;
- // â†’ AgentAction::Delegate { agent: &quot;SecurityExpert&quot; }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Supported Patterns**:
- - **Deep Research**: &quot;investigate X&quot;, &quot;research Y&quot;, &quot;analyze in depth Z&quot;
- - **Code Review**: &quot;review code&quot;, &quot;analyze implementation&quot;, &quot;check for bugs&quot;
- - **Security Audit**: &quot;security review&quot;, &quot;find vulnerabilities&quot;, &quot;CVE scan&quot;
- - **Orchestration**: &quot;coordinate agents&quot;, &quot;multi-agent session&quot;

- #### **Deep Research Implementation**
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;rust
- // Zero-cost web search with automatic fallback
- pub struct WebSearchProvider {
-     backends: Vec&lt;SearchBackend&gt;,
- }
- 
- pub enum SearchBackend {
-     DuckDuckGo,   // Free, no API key required (default)
-     Brave,        // Fast, requires BRAVE_API_KEY
-     Google,       // High quality, requires GOOGLE_API_KEY
-     Bing,         // Microsoft, requires BING_API_KEY
- }
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Fallback Chain**:
- 1. **Commercial APIs**: Brave â†’ Google â†’ Bing (if API keys available)
- 2. **DuckDuckGo Scraping**: HTML parsing with 30s timeout (always available)
- 3. **Official Formats**: Rust docs, Stack Overflow, GitHub (guaranteed fallback)
- 
- **Performance Metrics**:
- - DuckDuckGo: 1.5s avg response, 98% success rate, $0 cost
- - Brave: 0.75s avg response, 99.5% success rate, $3/1000 queries
- - With caching: 45x faster (&lt; 50ms for cached queries)

+

+

+ ## ğŸ“¦ Architecture
+ 
+ Prism is a Turborepo monorepo with the following structure:
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ prism/
+ â”œâ”€â”€ apps/
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ web/              # Next.js 15 Dashboard
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ desktop/          # Electron Desktop App
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ cli/              # CLI Tool
+ â”œâ”€â”€ packages/
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ types/            # Shared TypeScript types
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ git-core/         # Git Worktree + Orchestrated Edit
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ supervisor/       # AI Orchestration Engine
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ consensus/        # Voting &amp; Scoring
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ mcp-clients/      # MCP Clienté›†ç´„
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ blueprint/        # Blueprintå‡¦ç†
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ webhook/          # Webhookå‡¦ç†
+ â”œâ”€â”€ mcp-servers/          # 10+ MCP Servers (Rust + TypeScript)
+ â””â”€â”€ kernel-extensions/    # AI-Native OS (Linux + Windows)
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ ## ğŸ”§ Development
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ # Clone repository
+ git clone https://github.com/zapabob/prism.git
+ cd prism
+ 
+ # Install dependencies
+ npm install
+ 
+ # Start development servers
+ npm run dev
+ 
+ # Build all packages
+ npm run build
+ 
+ # Run tests
+ npm run test
+ 
+ # Type check
+ npm run type-check
+ 
+ # Lint
+ npm run lint
```

```diff
+ export function getScoreStats(scores: number[]): {

+   const mid = Math.floor(sorted.length / 2)
```

```diff
+ export class ConsensusBuilder {

+   async build(

+     }
+     
+     const selectedSolution = firstPreference ?? &#39;&#39;
+     
+     // ã‚¹ã‚³ã‚¢è¨ˆç®—
+     const solution = solutions.find(s =&gt; s.id === selectedSolution)
+     const finalScore = solution ? calculateScore(solution.metrics) : 0
+     
+     return {
+       selectedSolution,
+       selectionStrategy: &#39;unanimous&#39;,
+       finalScore,

+   /**
+    * æ±ºå®šãƒ­ã‚°ã‚’ä½œæˆ

+   private createDecisionLog(
+     votes: AgentVote[],
+     strategy: string
+   ): DecisionLog {
+     return {

+       votingRounds: 1,
+       finalDecision: strategy

+   }
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯çµæœã‹ã‚‰ã‚½ãƒªãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ã‚’æ§‹ç¯‰
+  * 
+  * @param results - ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯çµæœãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+  * @returns ã‚½ãƒªãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+  */
+ export function buildSolutions(results: TaskResult[]): SolutionWithMetrics[] {
+   return results.map(result =&gt; ({
+     id: result.stepId,
+     metrics: result.metrics,
+     output: result.output

+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * ç°¡æ˜“æŠ•ç¥¨ã‚’ç”Ÿæˆï¼ˆè‡ªå‹•ï¼‰
+  * 
+  * å„AIãŒè‡ªåˆ†ã®çµæœã«æŠ•ç¥¨ã—ã€ä¿¡é ¼åº¦ã¯ã‚¹ã‚³ã‚¢ãƒ™ãƒ¼ã‚¹
+  * 
+  * @param results - ã‚¿ã‚¹ã‚¯çµæœãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+  * @returns æŠ•ç¥¨ãƒªã‚¹ãƒˆ
+  */
+ export function generateAutoVotes(results: TaskResult[]): AgentVote[] {
+   return results.map(result =&gt; {
+     const score = calculateScore(result.metrics)

+     return {
+       agentName: result.agentType,

+     }
+   })
+ }
+ 
+ /**
+  * ãƒ˜ãƒ«ãƒ‘ãƒ¼: ã‚³ãƒ³ã‚»ãƒ³ã‚µã‚¹ã‚’æ§‹ç¯‰
+  */
+ export async function buildConsensus(
+   results: TaskResult[],
+   strategy: ConsensusStrategy
+ ): Promise&lt;ConsensusResult&gt; {
+   const solutions = buildSolutions(results)
```

```diff
+   private async executeStep(

+   private async validateCriteria(

+     for (const criteria of step.successCriteria) {
+       const passed = this.checkCriteria(criteria, result.metrics)
+       if (!passed) {

+         )
+         return false

+     
+     return true

+ 
+   /**
+    * å˜ä¸€æˆåŠŸæ¡ä»¶ã‚’ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯

+   private checkCriteria(
+     criteria: SuccessCriteria,

+   ): boolean {
+     const metricValue = metrics[criteria.metric as keyof ScoringMetrics]
+     
+     if (typeof metricValue !== &#39;number&#39;) {
+       return false
+     }
+     
+     const targetValue =
+       typeof criteria.value === &#39;number&#39;
+         ? criteria.value
+         : parseFloat(criteria.value)
+     
+     if (isNaN(targetValue)) {

+

+     
+     if (operator === &#39;gt&#39;) {

+     } else if (operator === &#39;gte&#39;) {

+     } else if (operator === &#39;lt&#39;) {
+       return metricValue &lt; targetValue
+     } else if (operator === &#39;lte&#39;) {

+     } else {

+     }
+   }
```

```diff
+   validate(blueprint: Blueprint): ValidationResult {

+   /**

+   private validateRequiredFields(blueprint: Blueprint): ValidationError[] {
+     const errors: ValidationError[] = []
+     
+     if (!blueprint.id || blueprint.id.trim() === &#39;&#39;) {

+     if (!blueprint.version || blueprint.version.trim() === &#39;&#39;) {
+       errors.push({

+       })
+     }
+     
+     if (!blueprint.steps || blueprint.steps.length === 0) {

+     // ä¾å­˜é–¢ä¿‚ã®å­˜åœ¨ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯
+     for (const step of steps) {

+         // å‡ºåŠ›å¤‰æ•°åãŒæœ‰åŠ¹ã‹ç¢ºèªï¼ˆç°¡æ˜“ãƒã‚§ãƒƒã‚¯ï¼‰

+   private hasCyclicDependencies(steps: BlueprintStep[]): boolean {
```

```diff
+ export abstract class BaseMCPClient {

+   /**

+   async start(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {

+     
+     this.process = spawn(this.config.command, this.config.args, {

+     
+     // stdoutã‹ã‚‰JSON-RPCãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚’èª­ã¿å–ã‚Š
+     if (this.process.stdout) {
+       let buffer = &#39;&#39;
+       
+       this.process.stdout.on(&#39;data&#39;, (chunk: Buffer) =&gt; {
+         buffer += chunk.toString(&#39;utf-8&#39;)
+         
+         // æ”¹è¡Œã§åˆ†å‰²ã—ã¦ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’å‡¦ç†
+         const lines = buffer.split(&#39;\n&#39;)

+         for (const line of lines) {

+     
+     // stderrã‚’ãƒ­ã‚°
+     if (this.process.stderr) {
+       this.process.stderr.on(&#39;data&#39;, (chunk: Buffer) =&gt; {

+       })
+     }
+     
+     // ãƒ—ãƒ­ã‚»ã‚¹çµ‚äº†æ™‚
+     this.process.on(&#39;exit&#39;, (code: number | null) =&gt; {

+       this.process = undefined
+       
+       // ã™ã¹ã¦ã®ä¿ç•™ä¸­ã®ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’æ‹’å¦
+       for (const [id, { reject }] of this.pendingRequests) {

+     })
+   }
+ 
+   /**

+    */
+   async stop(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {

+   /**
+    * ãƒªã‚¯ã‚¨ã‚¹ãƒˆã‚’é€ä¿¡

+    * @returns ãƒ¬ã‚¹ãƒãƒ³ã‚¹çµæœ
+    */
+   async sendRequest(method: string, params?: unknown): Promise&lt;unknown&gt; {
+     if (!this.process || !this.process.stdin) {

+     
+     const id = ++this.requestId

+       params
+     }
+     
+     // Promiseã‚’ä½œæˆã—ã¦ä¿å­˜
+     const promise = new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {

+     // ãƒ¡ãƒƒã‚»ãƒ¼ã‚¸ã‚’é€ä¿¡

+   /**

+   private handleMessage(line: string): void {
```

```diff
+ # Contributing to Prism
+ 
+ Thank you for your interest in contributing to Prism! ğŸ‰
+ 
+ ## Getting Started
+ 
+ 1. Fork the repository
+ 2. Clone your fork: &#96;git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/prism.git&#96;
+ 3. Create a branch: &#96;git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name&#96;
+ 4. Install dependencies: &#96;npm install&#96;
+ 5. Make your changes
+ 6. Run tests: &#96;npm test&#96;
+ 7. Run type check: &#96;npm run type-check&#96;
+ 8. Run linter: &#96;npm run lint&#96;
+ 9. Commit your changes: &#96;git commit -m &quot;feat: your feature description&quot;&#96;
+ 10. Push to your fork: &#96;git push origin feature/your-feature-name&#96;
+ 11. Open a Pull Request
+ 
+ ## Code Style
+ 
+ ### TypeScript
+ - Use strict TypeScript with no &#96;any&#96; types
+ - Follow ESLint rules
+ - Add JSDoc comments for public APIs
+ - Use descriptive variable names
+ 
+ ### Rust
+ - Follow Clippy lints
+ - Use inline format arguments
+ - Add comprehensive tests
+ - Document public APIs
+ 
+ ### Commit Messages
+ 
+ Follow Conventional Commits:
+ - &#96;feat:&#96; - New feature
+ - &#96;fix:&#96; - Bug fix
+ - &#96;docs:&#96; - Documentation only
+ - &#96;style:&#96; - Code style changes
+ - &#96;refactor:&#96; - Code refactoring
+ - &#96;test:&#96; - Adding tests
+ - &#96;chore:&#96; - Maintenance tasks
+ 
+ ## Testing
+ 
+ - Write unit tests for new features
+ - Ensure all tests pass before submitting
+ - Aim for 80%+ code coverage
+ 
+ ## Questions?
+ 
+ Open an issue or discussion on GitHub!
+ 
```

```diff
+           cd ../consensus &amp;&amp; npm run build
+           cd ../blueprint &amp;&amp; npm run build
+           cd ../webhook &amp;&amp; npm run build
+           cd ../mcp-clients &amp;&amp; npm run build
+
```

```diff
+ ## ğŸŒ³ Git Worktree Integration
+ 
+ ### Conflict-Free Development
+ 
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
+ main/
+ â”œâ”€â”€ .prism/worktrees/
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ai-codex-1730000000/    # Codex instance
+ â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ai-gemini-1730000001/   # Gemini instance
+ â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ai-claude-1730000002/   # Claude instance
+ &#96;&#96;&#96;
+ 
+ **Process**:
+ 1. Create worktree for each AI
+ 2. AI works in isolated branch
+ 3. Commit changes
+ 4. Vote on best solution
+ 5. Merge winner to main
+ 6. Clean up worktrees
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸ—³ï¸ Consensus Engine
+ 
+ ### Voting Strategies
+ 
+ 1. **Highest Score**: Select solution with best metrics
+ 2. **Majority Vote**: Most votes wins
+ 3. **Weighted Vote**: Confidence-weighted voting
+ 4. **Unanimous**: All AIs must agree
+ 
+ ### Scoring Metrics
+ 
+ - Test Success Rate (30%)
+ - Lint Pass Rate (15%)
+ - Performance Gain (20%)
+ - Change Risk (-15%)
+ - Readability Score (10%)
+ - Security Score (10%)
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ ## ğŸ–¥ï¸ AI-Native OS
+ 
+ ### Linux Kernel Modules
+ 
+ - **ai_scheduler.ko**: GPU-aware task scheduling
+ - **ai_mem.ko**: Pinned memory allocation for AI workloads
+ - **ai_gpu.ko**: GPU Direct Access
+ - **gpu_tracer**: eBPF-based CUDA kernel tracing
+ 
+ ### Windows Kernel Driver
+ 
+ - **ai_driver.sys**: AI task detection and priority boosting
+ - **codex_win_api**: Rust FFI bindings
+ - **ETW Provider**: Event Tracing for Windows
+

+ ## ğŸ”Œ MCP Integration

+

+ 6. **Playwright MCP**: Browser automation

+ 8. **YouTube MCP**: Subtitle extraction

+

+ ## ğŸ“Š 3D Git Visualization
+ 
+ ### Tech Stack
+ 
+ - **Frontend**: React Three Fiber + WebGL
+ - **Backend**: Rust (axum + git2)
+ - **Real-time**: WebSocket + File System Watcher
+ - **Optimization**: InstancedMesh, LOD, Web Workers
+ 
+ ### Features
+ 
+ - 3D/4D commit history graph (time axis)

+ - Branch structure visualization
+ - Timeline slider
+ - Search &amp; bookmarks

+ ## ğŸ”’ Security

+
```

```diff
- ## ğŸŒ³ Git Worktree Integration
- 
- ### Conflict-Free Development
- 
- &#96;&#96;&#96;bash
- main/
- â”œâ”€â”€ .prism/worktrees/
- â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ai-codex-1730000000/    # Codex instance
- â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ai-gemini-1730000001/   # Gemini instance
- â”‚   â””â”€â”€ ai-claude-1730000002/   # Claude instance
- &#96;&#96;&#96;
- 
- **Process**:
- 1. Create worktree for each AI
- 2. AI works in isolated branch
- 3. Commit changes
- 4. Vote on best solution
- 5. Merge winner to main
- 6. Clean up worktrees
-

- ## ğŸ—³ï¸ Consensus Engine
- 
- ### Voting Strategies
- 
- 1. **Highest Score**: Select solution with best metrics
- 2. **Majority Vote**: Most votes wins
- 3. **Weighted Vote**: Confidence-weighted voting
- 4. **Unanimous**: All AIs must agree
- 
- ### Scoring Metrics
- 
- - Test Success Rate (30%)
- - Lint Pass Rate (15%)
- - Performance Gain (20%)
- - Change Risk (-15%)
- - Readability Score (10%)
- - Security Score (10%)
-

- ### Windows Kernel Driver
- 
- - **ai_driver.sys**: AI task detection and priority boosting
```
